Job Title: External Reporting – Business Analyst - Senior Associate
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


As a Product Delivery Senior Associate on the External Reporting team you will be responsible for analyzing large sets of loan level data, evaluating and translating reporting instructions into sound and quality data, improving analytical review process, maintaining documentations on change control procedures. This position is primarily responsible for gathering, interpreting, and managing reporting requirements for external regulatory institutions (FDIC, FRB, OCC, etc.). This is a hands-on role with a great potential for career growth. We are looking for an individual with unique combination of strong technical (SQL) and interpersonal skills to drive the continuous data improvement. This role will work collaboratively with both internal team members and a wide range of partners from Home Lending Business, Technology, MIS and risk.

Job Responsibilities

Deep dive analysis of the data to ensure accuracy of reporting
Comfortable analyzing large data sets and conducting root cause analysis to understand and remediate reporting anomalies
Responsible for detailed documentation of Requirements/Requirement interpretation
Conduct data research to triage issues, identify root cause and recommend solutions to fix data defects
Work with other teams (IT, CCB Data Management & Risk etc.) to identify data issues and improve data quality for CCAR files and to effectively update logic during system conversions / decommissions as well as new acquisitions
Preparation of various reporting metrics for inclusion in presentations to Steering Committee and Management

Required qualifications, capabilities and skills

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics or related area
3+ years of Mortgage/Banking/finance analytical support experience
Strong SQL skills
Experience with delivering solutions through agile methodologies and new technologies
Advanced analytical and quantitative skills
Strong working knowledge of MS Excel and advanced data manipulation functions (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, ODBC, VBA)
Direct experience with Home Lending servicing system (MSP) to perform loan level review to determine RCA to assist in the remediation of Reporting discrepancies

Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills

Exposure to Python, Tableau and Alteryx

Required soft skills

Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills are critical
Works well collaboratively and independently in an ever-changing business environment

For this particular role, we are unable to sponsor any type of work visa including but not limited to H1B, H4 – EAD, OPT, TN, or L visas.

Candidates must be able to physically work in our Columbus, OH or Plano, TX offices 3 days a week and remotely from home 2 days per week. The specific schedule will be determined by direct management.

#LI-HYBRID

ABOUT US


Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America’s households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.


We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans




ABOUT THE TEAM

Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.



Global Finance & Business Management works to strategically manage capital, drive growth and efficiencies, maintain financial reporting and proactively manage risk. By providing information, analysis and recommendations to improve results and drive decisions, teams ensure the company can navigate all types of market conditions while protecting our fortress balance sheet.

Why finance at Stryker?

Are you looking for a profitable and growing company with a great culture and reputation? Stryker was recently named one of the Best Workplace in the WORLD by Fortune! Here, you will have many opportunities to learn and grow as we offer development opportunities unique for each employees needs including training, certifications, mentorship, leadership programs, tuition reimbursement, one-on-one coaching and more!

We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com


Who We Want

Data translators. Highly effective communicators who can transform data findings into recommendations to compose reports and executive level presentations.

Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes – finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.

Plug and play. Ability to operate in an ambiguous environment with constantly changing priorities – can prioritize, arrange, and focus on what matters and importantly, follow through

What You Will Do

As the Lead Analyst, you will support and lead (certain areas) management within the Global Inventory COE for all business areas (O&S, MSNT, Europe, international or GQO). Your primary role will be supporting the reporting structure of inventory which includes having an understanding of information need and report creations, the flow of information through the different ERP’s and other reporting/information systems, advanced analytics reporting, variance analysis reporting, and forecasting (reporting). Additionally, you will provide support for all stakeholder management, in leading all inventory related business support reporting, like month end cycles, including all Flash call reporting support, Balance Sheet reviews reporting, Cash Flow reporting, projections/budget cycles reporting, and any business initiatives related to optimizing inventory reporting, supporting transitions of accounting or inventory work reporting, or system implementations. You will not manage any direct reports.

Business Support reporting:

Leading to inform the manager and directors for identifying and defining all reporting needs to precisely and effectively report on metrices, KPI’s, variances and progress for Global Inventory COE

Reporting could entail consolidated overviews for the divisions, Business review slides, flash comment files, PowerBi, Metrics, KPI’s, Balance reviews, cash flow reviews, projections, budgets, regular balances and trends overviews across divisions, progress reports, updating databases and translate needs into report, etc.

Leading the manager and director(s) on the distribution of reports within the organization.

Leading for making the reports accurate, timely and relevant (reconciled).

Analyze and forecast financial, economic and other data to provide accurate and timely information for strategic and operational decisisions.

Support on possible ad hoc analysis and reports

Leading the production of periodic reports

As Lead Analyst you execute many of the same activities as the manager for certain topics, divisions

Develop

Support in development and maintain dashboard and report documentation

Support in developing automated tools and visualizations to provide real-time insights to business data

Support in developing governance process with notifications and guidance to developers and leaders

About us:

We are Deoleo. The Olive Oil Company

For centuries, our olive oil has been a staple of kitchens around the globe. Armed with knowledge and passion, we are focused on producing quality olive oil and leading our industry into a more sustainable future.

Deoleo is the world’s largest olive oil company with world-leading brands such as Carbonell, Bertolli, and Carapelli. Producing our oil in Spain and Italy; and distributing our brands from Australia to Alaska. We´re a multinational company with offices in many locations, headquartered in Madrid, Spain.

Our mission is to nurture healthier futures by making Mediterranean goodness available to all.

Our ambition is to be the undisputed leader of the olive oil industry.

Without compromising traditional flavors, the company strives to offer premium-quality products in line with today’s lifestyles. All of Deoleo’s brands meet and exceed the extensive, strict quality requirements of the International Olive Council (IOC), and the European Union (EU). Beyond olive oil, Deoleo products include premium vinegars and the finest table olives available.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for an ambitious and talented profile to join our Commercial Department as Sales Analyst (Onsite) Located in Dallas.

MISSION

The Sales Analyst role aims to bolster and assist regional Sales teams by generating insightful reports that support sales initiatives. This position involves offering key insights into sales trends across essential items and categories. Additionally, the role entails providing cross-functional support in collaboration with Marketing, Finance, and Operations.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Conduct comprehensive sales and market data analysis for both internal and external stakeholders in a dynamic environment.
Perform competitive analysis across manufacturers, brands, and package types, identifying trends, opportunities, and challenges crucial to core business areas.
Utilize syndicated and/or retailer-specific data to formulate, organize, and present information and recommendations supporting the sales team and critical retail initiatives. This includes assessing retailer performance, identifying trends and opportunities, evaluating pricing and promotion effectiveness, etc.
Provide comprehensive commercial support to the sales team, including information dissemination, monthly reporting, regional scorecards, and the creation of impactful selling stories.
Develop and assist in the creation of presentation decks for customer meetings.
Develop and refine category strategies and tactics in collaboration with Marketing to build customer partnerships that deliver volume and profit goals.
Create promotional analysis to support Regional Business Managers' promotional decisions.
Ensure timely entry of baselines and promotions into our forecasting software.
Act as a technical resource for the business, proficiently handling reporting tools such as Power BI and Excel Power Query.

Education

BS/BA degree in a business discipline or equivalent experience

Experience

1-2 years of experience in Sales, Category Management, or Planning within a CPG organization.
Proven ability to work with diverse data sources and strong analytical skills.
Experience with syndicated data (IRI, Nielsen, Spins) is a plus.
Highly skilled in a commercial mindset and understanding of marketing and sales principles.
Familiarity with data analysis and forecasting methods.

Competencies

Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Process-oriented, fact-based, and a sense of urgency.
Quick learner with a proactive approach to applying new technologies.
Strong analytical skills with a solution-oriented mindset.
Cross-cultural awareness and ability to collaborate with diverse cultures.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (DAX, Power Query (M)) and PowerPoint.
Advanced skills in Power BI or Tableau preferred.
SQL and Python knowledge is a plus.
Fluent in spoken and written English. Spanish is a plus.

Job Title: MBA Rotational Program - Associate Business Analyst
Job Description:
MBA Rotational Program - Associate Business Analyst

We are searching for…
MBA talent passionate about making lives better. Axxess is a leading technology innovator for healthcare at home focused on solving the most complex industry challenges. As a member of our team, you will collaborate and present innovative health solutions that have a global impact. As an emerging leader you will be exposed to Axxess’ business processes on teams such as Product, Marketing, Finance, Engineering and Client Experience to name a few. You deliver creative solutions, while leading challenging projects connected to our Axxess’ business objectives. This opportunity is for MBA professionals with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, build professional skills and advance a global career. Join us as a Associate Business Analyst.

What you will experience...
A one-year program, designed to provide professional development for career growth and advancement
Mentorship and engagement with senior leadership across the business
Global experience, to include a two-week residency in global markets
Deployment to an Axxess team upon successful completion of the rotational program
A fast-paced, collaborative team-oriented environment that encourages everyone to bring their authentic self to work every day
Competitive compensation with full selection of benefits, including company-matching 401k contributions and 20 days of paid time off + holidays + birthdays
Who we are…
It’s simple. We do business differently, by empowering our team to create fresh ideas which impact lives everywhere. We don’t just dream it; we do it every day at Axxess, we bring life-changing technology to healthcare impacting the way people work, learn, and grow their business. Our edge does not come from our technology, it comes from our people. We work as one team with a common goal to create shared success benefiting everyone.

What you will do…
Develop creative solutions to challenging issues
Gain knowledge and understanding of industry trends, KPI’s and analysis and the overall competitive landscape
Engage with our partners and clients to identify challenges and develop marketing strategies, adoption and of solutions
Develop partnerships in emerging markets
Manage project schedules and communicate risk to stakeholders

What do you bring...
Currently, pursuing an MBA from a college or university, with a graduation date in 2023 or May 2024
Undergraduate degree from an accredited college or university (3.3 minimum GPA, preferred)
Demonstrated success with a minimum of two years of post-baccalaureate professional work experience
High level of business and global acumen
Ability to travel domestically and internationally
Exemplified leadership on previous projects
Collaborative with a learning mindset and desire for continuous improvement

You are better prepared if you…
Possess passion about increasing access to quality healthcare globally
Have contributed to high-performing teams or organizations
Lead strategic planning and implementation
Desire an exciting experience in a rapidly growing privately held company

MBA Timeline:
Apply - November 2023 - January 2024
Interview -
February 2024
Final selection -
March 2024
Axxess orientation -
June 5, 2024
Global office visit -
Spring 2025
Deployment to Axxess team -
June 2025
Axxess is an equal opportunity employer and drug-free workplace. All applicants must be authorized to work in and currently reside in the United States. We offer a competitive compensation package (DOE), benefits and growth opportunities for everyone who joins Axxess!

Job Title

Senior Technical Business Analyst

Summary of the role:

The the Search, Shopping and Pricing division is looking for a Shopping and Pricing Subject Matter Expert - Airlines; to be able to understand the technical and functional complexity of Shopping and Pricing software system, provide expertise and premium assistance to airlines and manage internal communication with other divisions and with customer. The mission of the Search, Shopping and Pricing division is to offer travel search and travel solution pricing expertise to major customers such as Expedia, Kayak, Southwest, Air Canada and Delta. Our scalable platform is massively distributed, and integrated to the huge Amadeus ecosystem managing massive traffic daily. We are offering a large panel of products and integrated solutions orchestrating flows and providing assistance to the customer on the entire end-to-end process of search for a flight solution, tailor and price it, book and issue the ticket, including the possibility of repricing and reissuance for a change of journey. Southwest and Hawaiian airlines are major customers in the region and we need a technical business analyst able to understand the technical and functional complexity of this software ecosystem, provide expertise and premium assistance to them and manage internal communication with other divisions and with customer. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills on different kinds of tasks

In this role you'll:

Act as primary entry point in areas requiring expertise
For transversal solution escalation points
Analyze and capture solution elements for large cross functional CPs, and other complex cross-organization, cross-functional
solutions
Respond to the needs of the Central and/or Regional commercial organization in close collaboration with all Pdef and Dev teams of the division
Identify areas of repeat/common use and document coherent, re-usable solution responses
Provide support and expertise to Product, Sales and Account teams in functional, technical recommendation for new solution including
Contribute and support in the preparation of RFI/P responses and other ad hoc customer requests
Provide recommendation for new solution in collaboration with R&D teams and coordinate input
Analyze needs and requirements, from customer and internal sources, and propose functional/technical solution recommendations with supporting rationale
Document and present solution recommendations
Support new business opportunity study when it comes to complex solution
Develop, Maintain and share solution analysis and expertise with the wider division
Define and execute the communication/training strategy
Build and deliver Training material: tutorials, user guide, videos
Define , develop and implement communication between commercial organization and R&D organization on complex solution or escalation.
Design the tools which will support the process, taking into account User Experience principles
Track and Measure the performance of the overall functional/technical solution determination processes and propose and implement improvements.

About the Ideal Candidate:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
5+ years of experience in the offered role, IT travel industry, technical business analysis, product definition, or in another related position.
Airline IT end-to-end business understanding with a particular focus on the Pricing, Ticket change and reissuance, after sale.
Flight Search knowledge and undestanding of the complexity of the search problems and customer espectations on KPIs (Response time, Price Accuracy, Content and cheapest price findability).
Knowledge on business specificities on American customers (Southwest, AirCanada, Kayak Fareportal, Expedia ...) would be appreciated.
Computing Knowledge: Linux Systems, Knowledge in C/C++ and Python preferred
Languages: English is a must, French is a plus
Specific Knowledge: EDIFACT protocol, Pricing, Airline Fare filing. Data analytics knowledge/interest preferred
Other Knowledge: Communication skills, team work, Software Development Methodologies (Agile and Waterfall), Coordination Skills, Leadership. Experience with customer and premium support.
Ability to travel 5% within the US, France and Canada

What we can offer you:

Get rewarded with competitive remuneration, individual and company annual bonus, vacation and holiday paid time off, health insurances and other competitive benefits.
Professional development to broaden your knowledge and enhance your skills with on-line learning hubs packed with technical and soft skills training that allow you to develop and grow.
Enter a diverse and inclusive workplace, join one of the world’s top travel technology companies and take on a role that impacts millions of travelers around the globe.

Application process:

The application process takes no longer than 10 minutes!
Create your candidate profile, upload your Resume/CV and apply today!

The Pricing Operations Analyst is primarily responsible for supporting programs by managing the equipment and offering price processes, performing program/business-related analysis, providing data-driven answers to business questions, and supporting business development activities. The role will be expected to manage analysis work streams by collecting business needs and working with program data to provide insights that drive strategic decisions. This role will also utilize formal training and/or a high level of first-hand experience to understand business needs translating to developing models and tracking performance across Assurant’s Device Lifecycle Solutions (DLS) global programs.

What will my duties and responsibilities be in this job?

Guide, manage, and collaborate cross-functionally with internal teams to support offer/TIV pricing activities:

IT teams responsible for DLS platforms (includes technical knowledge and understanding)

In country and regional program management teams supporting program needs (includes business acumen and understanding)

Operations teams supporting physical processing of devices (includes working knowledge of supply chain fundamentals)

Interact and respond to requests from clients and account management teams

Support and work with business development teams to drive new program growth

Responsible for helping develop and support Global program performance monitoring:

Track key program KPIs

Monitor data accuracy

Provide feedback and insights to internal leadership and external clients

Bridge internal technical and program teams

Skills expected in this role include:

Project Management

Concurrently handle multiple tasks and minimum scope projects

Collaborate effectively with management and teams at all levels to accomplish goals

Lead project meetings/team efforts to meet goals

Analytics Technical Skills

Develop solutions and recommendations for improving data integrity through applying in-depth business understanding

Responsible for designing improvements, developing, managing quality control, documenting data flows, and ongoing maintenance for program data

Responsible for querying large data sets and transforming data into digestible intelligence for diverse audiences

Business Acumen

Participate in the development of reporting solutions according to business and technical requirements

Document existing and new business workflows with applicable metrics and measures

Closely coordinate activities with internal cross-functional teams in order to optimize DLS program management processes

Analyze factors in the marketplace impacting the program

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment with flexibility to support ambiguous requests

What are the requirements needed for this position?

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, analytics or similar

A minimum of 2+ years’ experience in a related field

Experience in database management tools (e.g., MS SQL Server, Oracle SQL, SSIS (ETL), and UC4)

Experience using advanced features of MS Excel, MS Visual Basic, Tableau, and SQL for writing queries for extracting information out of databases

Experience in common data analytics programming software (e.g., R, SAS, STATA, or Python)

Experience creating financial models and program analysis to drive program results

What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?

Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively perform system support duties

Ability to quickly learn new applications

Ability to process time-sensitive data and information from multiple sources, make decisions, and communicate actions

Ability to prioritize, organize, and work independently, or as part of a project team, to complete multiple tasks

Requires the ability to perform detailed work

Requires strong interpersonal skills

Working knowledge of wireless handsets

Job Title: Global EDD Operations Analyst - Hybrid (Irving, TX)
Job Description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 7th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 160,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.

With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.

Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.

This is a hybrid position. The selected colleague will work at an MUFG office or client sites up to four days per week and work remotely the remaining day(s). A member of our Talent Acquisition team will provide more details.

The Enhanced Due Diligence (“EDD”) Operations Analyst will be responsible for performing EDD on Financial Institution (“FFI”) clients, for examples Foreign Banks, Foreign Financial Institutions, Broker-Dealers, Money Service Businesses (“MSBs”), Third-Party Payment Processors (“TPPPs”) etc. The Analyst will be responsible for reviewing a variety of cases of varying complexity, requiring a level of experience needed to effectively assess client’s profile, its AML program, transactions, and customer relationships, and provide holistic assessment of the potential financial crime risks.

Major Responsibilities:

The analyst will review and ensure that EDD documentation is appropriate.
Review and assess information about the FFIs’ AML programs, for example by using the Wolfsberg CBDDQ responses
Review transactional data and identify any potential red flags/inconsistencies within a given timeframe
Conduct screening in accordance with Bank policy and escalate true hits to Adverse Findings.
Identify red flags and escalate accordingly using sound judgement
Synthesize information from multiple data sources into a clear evaluation and recommended actions
Prepare detailed and concise client narratives
Generates a list of Proposed Questions for AML Advisory in preparation for the customer site visit/call
Performs additional due diligence based on the outcome of the Site Visits/Calls as needed
In addition to maintaining daily operations, ad-hoc projects will be assigned regularly

Qualifications:

3 to 5 years’ experience in AML/BSA Compliance & KYC preferably within the financial services industry with experience conducting EDD on foreign financial institutions.
Experience reviewing comprehensive documents inclusive of complex ownership structures and Wolfsberg Questionnaires (CBDDQ, FCCQ and AML programs of FI clients.
Strong working knowledge of AML/BSA/OFAC laws and regulations relative to money laundering and terrorist financing and the ability to apply this knowledge in assessing transaction activity and customer profiles.
Excellent organizational, communication (with a focus on writing), interpersonal, and analytical skills, are required. Must be able to multi-task, adapt well to changing priorities, and effectively prioritize workflow to meet critical deadlines.
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills a must.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding environment and must work well under pressure.
The ability and willingness to work both independently and in a team environment is required.
Maintains effective working relationships with key business partners.
Familiarity with Actimize and other financial crime, risk and compliance applications is a plus.
Effective Internet and research skills and usage of third party tools.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Bachelor’s Degree and CAMS certification preferred or equivalent work experience.

The typical base pay range for this role is between $65k-$75k depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location. This role may also be eligible for certain discretionary performance-based bonus and/or incentive compensation. Additionally, our Total Rewards program provides colleagues with a competitive benefits package (in accordance with the eligibility requirements and respective terms of each) that includes comprehensive health and wellness benefits, retirement plans, educational assistance and training programs, income replacement for qualified employees with disabilities, paid maternity and parental bonding leave, and paid vacation, sick days, and holidays. Job Title: Senior Analyst, Crew Strategy and Intelligence
Job Description:
Location: DFW Headquarters Building 8 (DFW-SV08)
Additional Locations: None
Requisition ID: 70134

Intro

Are you ready to explore a world of possibilities, both at work and during your time off? Join our American Airlines family, and you’ll travel the world, grow your expertise and become the best version of you. As you embark on a new journey, you’ll tackle challenges with flexibility and grace, learning new skills and advancing your career while having the time of your life. Feel free to enrich both your personal and work life and hop on board!

Why you'll love this job
This job is a member of the Integrated Operations Team within the Integrated Operations Division.
Responsible for analyzing crew operations data, builds statistical predictive models and creates customized reports and PowerPoint presentations for executive leaders.
What you'll do
Derive meaningful and actionable insights from data that to help improve the crew operation
Develops statistical predictive models on large-scale datasets using statistical modeling such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees and other machine learning, or data mining techniques
Builds optimization and combinatorics models for optimal resource allocations
Performs advanced business analysis using SQL and Python to develop prescriptive operational improvement plans
Builds data visualization tools for root cause analysis
Automates and improves current programs, processes, reports and forecasts using SQL, Python, and etc.
Analyzes and develops requirements and provides documentation for IT projects
Develop presentations and present findings with recommendations to key stakeholders and senior management
Work collaboratively with various teams across the crew domain (Crew Scheduling, Crew Planning, Flight, Flight Service, IOC, etc.) to develop innovative and insightful solutions to improve crew performance
All you'll need for success

Minimum Qualifications- Education & Prior Job Experience

Bachelor's Degree in Applied Statistics, Data Mining, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics or related quantitative field
3 years of related experience
1 year of experience with SQL querying and/or reporting or equivalent coursework

Preferred Qualifications- Education & Prior Job Experience

Master's Degree in Applied Statistics, Data Mining, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics
Programming experience with Python, Aviation experience, Credit scoring experience, Marketing analytics Experience

Skills, Licenses & Certifications

The Sr Sales Process Optimization Analyst will support the organization by focusing on: Report Development, Quality Control, and Product Management, Process Improvement and automation. They will also be responsible for enhancing and maintaining Power BI and Data Visualization tools. This highly visible position will have the opportunity to work across the organization, with multiple layers of employees and management, and be part of building out a Data Analytics department for the organization.

Develop and establish reporting to track and maintain operations. Up-to-date monitoring of operations with the goal of implementing continuous improvements.
Streamlining and automating reports using G Suite, Microsoft Suite, WinShuttle, etc.

Department Business Systems Analyst - (DEA00000410)
Description


Salary Range:

Salary commensurate with experience and qualifications

About SMU

SMU’s more than 12,000 diverse, high-achieving students come from all 50 states and over 80 countries to take advantage of the University’s small classes, meaningful research opportunities, leadership development, community service, international study and innovative programs.

SMU serves approximately 7,000 undergraduates and 5,000 graduate students through eight degree-granting schools: Dedman College of Humanities and Sciences, Cox School of Business, Lyle School of Engineering, Meadows School of the Arts, Simmons School of Education and Human Development, Dedman School of Law, Perkins School of Theology and Moody School of Graduate and Advanced Studies.

SMU is data driven, and its powerful supercomputing ecosystem – paired with entrepreneurial drive – creates an unrivaled environment for the University to deliver research excellence.

Now in its second century of achievement, SMU is recognized for the ways it supports students, faculty and alumni as they become ethical, enterprising leaders in their professions and communities. SMU’s relationship with Dallas – the dynamic center of one of the nation’s fastest-growing regions – offers unique learning, research, social and career opportunities that provide a launch pad for global impact.

SMU is nonsectarian in its teaching and committed to academic freedom and open inquiry.

About the Department:

Development and External Affairs (DEA) supports SMU by securing funding for University priorities; by promoting meaningful involvement in the life and work of the University; by heightening international, national, state and local awareness of SMU; and by supporting the enrollment of a diverse and able student body.

DEA comprises the offices of Office of the Vice President, Annual Giving and Alumni Relations, Development Services, Program Services and Donor Relations, Marketing and Communications, Principal and Major Gifts, and School and Project Development.

SMU continues to leverage the benefits from the largest fund-raising campaign in its history to achieve dramatic increases in academic quality and impact.

About the Position:

This role is an on-campus, in-person position.

The Department Business Systems Analyst is responsible for creating and maintaining data automation processes for the
Blackbaud CRM donor/alumni database (BBEC) and the PeopleSoft Campus Solutions student system (My.SMU),
ensuring data integrity, and accessibility to support Development and External Affairs initiatives.

This role serves as the primary resource for bulk updates of constituent records from various sources via designated tasks and special data augmentation and import projects. The Department Business Systems Analyst will also analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve workflow processes and audit reports.

This position reports directly to the Assistant Director of Constituent Records, who oversees overall data integrity in
Blackbaud CRM.

Essential Functions:

Manage constituent data and data upload automation processes including management of the existing bridge
between PeopleSoft Campus Solutions and Blackbaud CRM, oversight and assignment of mass upload requests.




Respond to and execute mass-change requests including biographic/demographic information, academic data, solicit
codes, life changes, and more from on-line forms, SMU Network (Alumni Directory), NCOA, AlumniFinder, My.SMU,
and critical "new parents" data ingestion process using required MS Access skills.




Create and maintain data integration tools and perform necessary modifications, documenting work-flow processes.
Evaluate and streamline processes as necessary and communicate with leadership as needed for maintenance of
processes and/or creation of new processes.




Create, prioritize and track special projects to meet deadlines in partnership with Project Management office. Projects
may involve simple updates, complex updates, research, analytical thought, and problem resolution skills as well as other responsibilities. Assist Assistant Director and Director with managing collaborative projects.




Participate in scheduled testing in both BBEC and My.SMU relating to patches, upgrades and enhancements.




Propose problem resolution and provide insight to supervisor and customers as needed; work with the Assistant
Director of Constituent Records to set systems and document procedures; general auditing of data on a scheduled
and as needed basis in partnership with Quality Assurance Specialist.




Ongoing data maintenance responsibilities.



Qualifications


Education and Experience:

A high school diploma or equivalent and nine years full-time work experience is required.




OR

A Bachelor's degree and five years of full-time work experience.

A minimum of two years of work experience in a data management role is also required.

Work experience in data automation and/or data validation preferred. Experience in non-profit or higher education desired.




Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Candidate must demonstrate strong interpersonal and verbal communication skills, with the ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with a wide range of constituencies. Must also demonstrate strong written communication skills. A strong customer service orientation is essential.




Candidate must possess strong problem-solving skills with the ability to identify and analyze problems, as well as devise solutions. Must also be able to assess and troubleshoot existing workflow processes and implement appropriate solutions as needed.

Candidate must have strong organizational, planning, and time management skills. The ability to work independently within a team environment and meet department goals and deadlines is required.




Candidate must have a strong working knowledge of MS Access and MS Excel is required. Must be able to troubleshoot and modify existing MS Access databases. An aptitude for data analysis and analytical thinking in approaching data challenges is essential.

Candidate must also have a working knowledge of relational databases and familiarity with data transformation. The ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues like database performance, database capacity, replication, and other data-related issues is essential.

VBA knowledge is desirable. Experience with PeopleSoft and Blackbaud CRM is preferred. ETL Developer Skills including Debugging/Problem Solving, ability to collaborate with other IT teams to modify and enhance existing BI assets is a plus.

Physical and Environmental Demands:

Sit for long periods of time

Ability to work at a desk and at a computer for extended periods of time




Deadline to Apply:

December 15, 2023




Priority consideration may be given to submissions received by December 8, 2023.

EEO Statement:

SMU will not discriminate in any program or activity on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or gender identity and expression. The Executive Director for Access and Equity/Title IX Coordinator is designated to handle inquiries regarding nondiscrimination policies and may be reached at the Perkins Administration Building, Room 204, 6425 Boaz Lane, Dallas, TX 75205, 214-768-3601, accessequity@smu.edu.

Benefits:

SMU offers staff a broad, competitive array of health and related benefits. In addition to traditional benefits such as health, dental, and vision plans, SMU offers a wide range of wellness programs to help attract, support, and retain our employees whose work continues to make SMU an outstanding education and research institution.

SMU is committed to providing an array of retirement programs that benefit and protect you and your family throughout your working years at SMU and, if you meet SMU's retirement eligibility criteria, during your retirement years after you leave SMU.

The value of learning at SMU isn't just about preparing our students for the future. Employees have access to a wide variety of professional and personal development opportunities, including tuition benefits.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Global Operations Analyst is responsible for supporting supply chain, global operations and EHSS with analytics and reporting: from analyzing estimates and quotations data, to procurement and logistics data, planning and inventory data, to generation of demand management reports and supporting S&IOP process, compliance programs and EHSS. This position ensures goals, objectives, actions, strategies, and tactics produce the desired results consistent with the needs of the organization and attainment of Company and Department key performance indicators and targets. This position is responsible for developing data-driven solutions to optimize operations, EHSS and supply chain operations, increase efficiency, and reduce costs. This role supports data generation, analytics, complex reporting, dashboards and scorecards administration and maintenance. This position plays a crucial role in optimizing the procurement process for direct and indirect goods and services. This position is responsible for analyzing procurement activities and assisting in compliance reporting and identifying cost-saving opportunities. This position collaborates with cross-functional teams to drive efficiency, minimize risk, and achieve the organization's goals.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

This job description represents only the primary areas of responsibility; specific position assignments will vary depending on the needs of the department. To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to execute each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 Generates data, analytics, reporting.  Identifies, visualizes, and analyzes data from a variety of sources to obtain business insights and provide reporting analytics.  Develops clear data analyses, visualizations, and stories that identify trends and issues, drive actions with data that produce favorable business outcomes. Conducts statistical analyses and builds predictive and prescriptive models to support data'driven decision making.  Provides analytical support across supply chain disciplines such as spend, performance, demand management, inventory management, capacity management and others.  Analyzes supply chain data and identify areas for improvement.  Builds Should-Cost and Total Cost of Ownership economic models for materials and services.  Develops and maintains dashboards, scorecards, and reports to track KPIs and provide insights to management for EHSS, Operations and Supply Chain.  Provides support to management team and senior leadership.  Develops processes and tools to measure key performance indicators.  Develops and implements predictive analytical models to optimize operations and reduce costs such as optimization models for inventory management and others and evaluate leading indicators.  Monitors, analyzes, interprets data, and report industry trends to identify new opportunities for improvement and cost reduction.  Assesses external market trends and conditions to identify opportunities and risks in managed spend categories.  Provides monthly analysis of Company spend to enable informed decision-making.  Monitors and evaluates risks.  Analyzes data to provide a variety of reports such as: inventory reports to optimize inventory levels, lead times reports, safety stocks, MOQ’s, forecast consumption and accuracy, supplier spend data and others. Develop and create schedules for products and services.  Extracts data, analyzes, and prepares reports to measure key supplier performance-to-plan. Provides reports on supplier performance, recommends continuous improvement opportunities.  Support Supplier Performance Management process and S&IOP process. Identifies new Demand and Supply forecasting techniques or technologies to improve overall S&IOP process. Support the full integration of operations into the S&IOP process. Partner with the finance organization to link S&IOP process with financial forecasts.  Conduct comprehensive analysis of direct and indirect procurement data, including spend analysis, market trends, supplier performance, and cost optimization opportunities. Gathers data and analyzes company spend, supply market data, and other related commercial information to drive value across supply chain activities and assists in identifying sourcing. Provides analytical support for category sourcing initiatives, contract negotiations, and bid evaluations.  Support EHSS and Company real estate management with development of dashboards, scorecards, and tracking analytics.  Developing tools and processes to improve the efficiency of analytical work. Develops, documents, and implements processes and systems in support of company goals. Creates specifications for system enhancements when necessary.  Collaborate with representatives from EHSS, Accounts Payable, Finance, Supply Chain, IT to continually seek advancement of integrated systems and drive operational excellence.  Leverage ERP systems knowledge to identify and prioritize areas of greatest opportunity for improvement and applications of data analysis.  Advance best practices for use of business intelligence and other data analytics tools. Identify, prioritize, and solve high-impact business problems.  Performs other duties of a similar nature and level as assigned.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree in data science and analytics, engineering, mathematics/statistics, business or major in related quantitative discipline. Master’s degree in related quantitative discipline preferred.  Data analysis statistical modeling experience with strong background in supply chain modeling, decision support tools development.  Experience with analytical programming languages such as SQL preferred.  Experience administering corporate level dashboards and scorecards.  ERP experience (Epicor, D365 preferred).  Demonstrated experience with business intelligence software Power BI, SharePoint, advanced Excel user knowledge and knowledge of building Macros preferred.  Familiarity with Hyperion, TM1 preferred.  5 years’ relevant data analytics experience required.  Previous experience as Data Scientist preferred.  Functional knowledge of planning and supply chain (i.e., planning, procurement, finished good supply chain) with focus on data analytics and ability to develop quantitative models in a supply chain context.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Strong project management skills that demonstrate the ability to initiate, prioritize and complete projects on time.  Excellent verbal, written communication skills and report presentation skills.  Industrial equipment manufacturing experience preferred such as: pumps, motors, valves, raw materials, actuators, welding, machining, painting, fabrication, resin, and fiberglass reinforced plastic.  Experience with ISO requirements and quality standards preferred.  Lean Six Sigma experience preferred.  Experience with supply chains with multiple locations preferred.  Microsoft Office experience including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Teams.

LICENSING/CERTIFICATIONS:

 Data Science certification preferred.  CPIM, APICS or ISM certification preferred.  Green Belt Lean Six Sigma certification preferred.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:

International air travel may be required, as necessary; must have ability to travel across borders

Overview:

We are seeking a Sales Analyst who will work closely with our National Account and Lighting Retail sales teams. As the Sales Analyst for Arteriors, you will be responsible for analyzing sales data and providing actionable insights to optimize product performance and drive revenue growth across our key domestic retail partners. This role will enable business transformation by creating a data-driven, insight-based culture throughout our e-commerce channels, Lighting Showroom, and National accounts.


The ideal candidate will excel in developing internal systems and processes that assist our business partners in maximizing their revenue potential with the Arteriors brand. Additionally, the ideal candidate for this role is highly analytical and organized, understands an omni-channel business model with experience in retail reporting, and has a passion for analyzing large datasets.


What began over 35 years ago as a boutique accessories company has evolved into a global force in the design industry. With premier lighting, furniture and accessories, Arteriors redefines interior spaces through unexpected creativity and meticulous craftsmanship. Pursuit of innovation drives us forward. Our imagination never rests. And thanks to our uniquely diverse and talented employee base, we are inspired to continue the remarkable journey. Arteriors embraces creativity in all its forms, from products and ideas to inventive, curious employees who think of themselves as tastemakers rather than followers. Innovation is impossible without our diverse team and their ideas, so we focus on creating a diverse workplace that promotes employee differences and creates an inclusive culture. Our aim is to provide our team members with an equitable experience.


Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Insights:
Conduct competitive analysis to identify market trends, benchmark against competitors, and recommend strategies to gain a competitive edge.
Translate complex data sets into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Collects and interprets sell-thru data with a proficient understanding of SEO best practices.
Identify patterns and trends in data sets by product category, aesthetic, price point, and other essential product attributes by account.
Maintains iMAP and other online brand integrity and compliance standards.
Collects data and product information from dealers to understand their selling trends.


Coordination and Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Collaborate with marketing, sales, and retail partner teams to develop and execute e-commerce strategies that drive growth and enhance the customer experience on our partners sites.
Supports the sales teams that manage national accounts, lighting e-tailers and lighting showrooms’ online businesses with new item setups and product launches.
Streamline work to simplify processes and procedures across the digital ecosystem to be less manual and optimize efficiency.


Digital Presentation and Data Maintenance:
Prepare and present regular reports and dashboards to communicate findings and insights to cross-functional teams and management.
Create clear and concise data visualizations, graphs, and charts to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Maintain data within online platforms such as XO Lights and Lights America.
This job might be for you if::
5 years’ experience with retail sales data management, preferably in a similar industry (home furnishings, design, or fashion).
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, mathematics, or data analytics is preferred.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Proven experience in data analysis and reporting, preferably in a retail or consumer goods environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to diverse audiences.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively across teams
Possess a high degree of proficiency with MS Office products, especially with Excel and PowerPoint.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks at various stages simultaneously while meeting deadlines.
What's in it for you::
Medical, dental and vision insurance available the first day of the month after hire date
401k with employer matching
Unlimited Paid Time Off
Paid Volunteer Days, allowing you to give back to your community
9 paid holidays with early release before holidays
Annual bonus potential and merit increase potential
Generous employee discount
Employee referral bonus

Overview:
Maxor is seeking an experienced, remote-based IT Project Manager to join our Healthcare Analytics and Business Intelligence team. The IT Project Manager is responsible to manage and oversee all aspects of a technology project to ensure it is completed on-time and within budget. Has overall responsibility for managing scope, cost, schedule, vendors, and contractual deliverables. Work directly with business to define scope and then ensure deliverables fall within the agreed up scope and budget. Develops detailed project plans. Monitors project milestones and generates periodic status reports. Evaluates and manages risk. Incorporates quality measures and standards to project deliverables. Possesses strong knowledge of technology. Work is generally performed independent and collaborative in nature. Contributions to moderately complex tasks within the job function.

Position Location
This is a remote-based position where you will work from your home office.

Our Company
Founded in 1926, Maxor is a leading, independent pharmacy solutions platform that improves prescription drug affordability and outcomes. Over time, Maxor has built a unique and complementary suite of services and technology offerings that deliver clinical, financial and strategic value to patients, payors and providers across the pharmacy supply chain.

Maxor has a proud heritage of growth and innovation earned over the decades. Amarillo, Texas is the legacy headquarters for Maxor, but our talent base is national. We operate pharmacies and other business operation sites across the United States with more than 1100 employees working from 42 states.

Why Maxor?
Pharmacies are essential to healthcare, with nearly 90% of the US population living within 5 miles of one and seeing their pharmacist an average of 12 times a year. Providing a positive patient experience is crucial to ensuring patients adhere to their therapies.

At Maxor, we recognize that our employees are our most valuable assets. We actively seek and retain talented professionals who are mission-driven to improve healthcare outcomes for patients. Our employees are essential to their own well-being, finding fulfillment in meaningful work, competitive compensation, diverse and inclusive teams, and limitless career possibilities.

With a workforce of 1,000+ and almost a century of pharmacy experience, we offer the stability of a Fortune 500 company and the energy and innovation of a startup. Our expertise and technology support the entire pharmacy ecosystem, but our impact goes beyond pharmacy services. We enable pharmacy care.
Responsibilities:
Work under the general direction and with oversite from information technology leadership to independently manage Information Technology projects and manage the Information Technology product/project portfolio.
Lead a team of software IT professionals and ensure they produce high quality IT products and services.
Manage and oversee all aspects of a technology project to ensure it is completed on-time and within budget.
Manages, prepares and produces project management reports, timelines, budgets, and documentation
Manage software development and infrastructure projects using both Traditional (Waterfall) and Agile Software Development Life Cycle techniques
Ensure staff is informed of product upgrades or enhancements in a timely manner
Responsible for planning the work, managing a cross-functional team comprised of employees, contractors and vendors at distributed work locations, mitigating issues and risks, and communicating status.
Develop and mentor departmental staff by providing career coaching; motivate departmental staff, individually and as a group; understand and support diversity; and establish an effective team.
Conduct initial and annual performance evaluations.
Promote teamwork
Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Management, or similar discipline from an accredited college or university or equally relevant experience.
PMP is preferred.
Experience:
Experience in the Healthcare industry
Experience leading IT projects, preferably with cloud and data warehouse areas of focus
Seasoned experience in managing Software Development Projects using Traditional and Agile Development methodologies
Experience managing projects in tools like MS Project, JIRA, or Smartsheet
Experience leading Azure data-related projects is desirable
Experience with Microsoft products including Project, Outlook, Word, and Excel
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Assessing an organization's technology needs and making upgrade recommendations
Setting short and long-term IT implementation goals
Strong project leadership skills
Providing product ownership/expertise of IT developed solutions
Knowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of project management
Knowledge of project management techniques and tools
Proven experience in people management
Proven experience in strategic planning
Proven experience in change management
Ability to work with a diverse group of individuals
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
Excellent verbal & written communication skills.

WE OFFER

At Maxor, we foster a diverse and progressive culture that promotes a work-from-home model and a "dress-for-your-day" approach to work attire. Our team-oriented environment encourages collaboration and innovation.

We offer highly competitive compensation and comprehensive health benefits including:

Comprehensive mental health and wellbeing resources
Nationwide Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO with employee-friendly plan design, including a $850 individual annual medical deductible and $25 office visit copays, with low biweekly premiums
Company-paid basic life/AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance
Rx, dental, vision, other voluntary benefits, and FSA
Employer-matched 401k Plan
Industry-leading PTO plan
And more!

Apply today at https://www.maxor.com/careers/

Maxor is an EOE, including disability/vets

Summary:




We are seeking an experienced IT Project Manager with a background in Business Analysis to join our dynamic team. This role requires a unique blend of technical expertise and business acumen, making it an exciting opportunity for individuals who thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment who enjoy working with their customers. Strong leadership, strategic thinking, excellent problem-solving skills and exceptional communication skills will be needed to be successful in this role.




This position comes with world class compensation, benefits, 401(k) match, profit sharing, and PTO.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Manage and oversee projects from conception to completion, ensuring they are completed within time and budget constraints.
Oversee and manage the seamless integration of business acquisitions to include coordinating with various teams to ensure the successful transition and integration of systems, processes, and personnel; identify potential risks and challenges, developing mitigation strategies; and ensuring that the integration aligns with the overall strategic objectives of the organization.
Develop detailed project plans and monitor progress, adjusting as needed.
Conduct risk management to minimize project risks.
Use business analysis skills to improve systems and processes.
Translate business needs into technical requirements.
Facilitate communication between the IT team and business stakeholders.
Prepare and present progress reports to stakeholders.



Requirements:

Education and/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements for this position are listed below:

Bachelor’s degree in IT, Business, or related field
Proven experience as an IT Project Manager, preferably with experience in managing large system integrations.
Strong knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Certification in Project Management (PMP) or Business Analysis (CBAP).
Experience in Agile/Scrum methodologies.

Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:

Working Conditions:



The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
Usually, normal office working conditions.
Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time due to prolonged periods of sitting or standing.
Occasional overnight travel may be required.
Occasional visits to industrial/manufacturing settings, which may include exposure to various materials and chemicals, as well as extreme temperature conditions and loud machinery, and require appropriate personal protective equipment.

Overview:
At Raising Cane’s Chicken Fingers® we serve only the best tasting and most craveable chicken finger meals. It’s our ONE LOVE®. Our Crew makes it happen, our Culture makes it unique and the Community makes it all worthwhile.
Every talented Crewmember in our Restaurant Support Office (RSO) is important to our success and a value to our rapidly growing company. We all work with a sense of purpose and focus on our chicken finger meals, Customers, Crew, Communities and Company Culture. We are constantly striving to Raise The Bar. The future for Raising Cane’s is growth focused and we’re on the path to being one of the top ten restaurant companies in the United States.
Responsibilities:
Your Role at Raising Cane’s:

The Senior Analyst is responsible for supporting the Restaurants within their geographical division and providing actionable financial analysis using strong business acumen and communication skills. This role will be tasked with defining and implementing key systems and processes to drive scalable growth to achieve the company’s long-term goals.
The Senior Analyst will be tasked with owning and assisting with reporting and analysis, budgeting and forecasting, and strategic planning. This role will also be responsible for collaborating cross-functionally across the organization and with the senior leadership team to perform ad hoc analyses, prepare and deliver presentations.

Your Impact and Responsibilities:
Primary Responsibility - Restaurant Support
Provides timely, clear, and actionable commentary on financial results, key trends in the business, and forecasts to drive sales, profitability and operational improvements. Actionable reporting includes:
Granular restaurant-level sales and traffic analysis highlighting opportunities to the restaurants
Granular restaurant-level sales & traffic forecast reviews
Key restaurant-level expense analysis specifically for Cost of Goods Sold, Labor, and Operating Expense
Hours of operation analysis and other traffic opportunities within the restaurant
New restaurant reporting and analytics
Identifies financial and operational business opportunities within individual restaurants
Supports the financial and operational reporting analysis of restaurant operations for daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual sales
Specializes in one functional area of the restaurant business (sales, operations, staffing, etc.) and provides regular reporting and analyses to restaurants on that subject
Secondary Responsibility - Cross-Functional Business Support
Develops financial models and tools to identify trends, analyze results, and optimize profit to enhance reporting efficiencies at the restaurant and company levels
Prepares and provides the marketing team with actionable commentary on financial results, key trends in the business, and forecasts to drive sales, profitability, and departmental improvements. Actionable reporting and support includes:
Monthly and quarterly departmental business reporting
Promotional and discount reporting
Marketing activation and post-campaign impact / ROI analyses
Marketing spend and expense analysis
Tool development to support field marketing initiatives
System-wide donation tracking
Assists in implementing and supporting key technology enhancements that will allow the FP&A, and business intelligence departments to continue to meet the expectations of the growing organization including data warehouse and reporting tool capabilities, and IT systems including Hot Schedules, Great Plains, Aloha, and proprietary technology
Assists FP&A team and company leaders to build and prepare financial performance presentations
Supports all other system-wide analysis needs that do not fall under the scope of the individual Restaurant FP&A team(s)
Qualifications:
Requirements for Success:
3+ years multi-unit retail or restaurant industry financial analysis required (or equivalent experience)
Self-driven, flexible, and highly energetic with strong analytical, written, and verbal communication skills
Ability to work effectively and efficiently both independently and collaboratively
Proficient in various technology systems and able to adapt to new systems quickly, i.e. business intelligence and planning software
Demonstrated competence in the use of software tools for data extraction, manipulation, analysis, and presentation
Microsoft Proficient: Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Able to work out of the Dallas Restaurant Support Office located in Plano, TX
Able to travel as required
Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or related field / MBA or CPA preferred

Title: IT Business Systems Analyst


Reports to: IT Director


Position Overview:


The IT Business Systems Analyst is responsible for planning, designing, and implementing databases for Center programs. Activities involve interaction with various departments and end-user personnel to determine all pertinent data required to develop and maintain systems. The IT Business Systems Analyst will also focus on the strategic development, optimization, & maintenance of the organization’s IT systems. This individual will be a technical specialist collaborating with various departments to understand data needs, process efficiencies, & ensure optimal system operations.


Job Duties & Responsibilities:


Strategic Systems Management: Provide expert recommendations & strategic input to optimize IT systems, ensuring alignment with organizational needs & goals.
Systems Maintenance & Optimization: Oversee & maintain key organizational databases, ensuring operational excellence & advanced troubleshooting of issues.
Advanced Troubleshooting: Diagnose & resolve intricate system issues, going beyond typical user support to ensure uninterrupted system operations.
Interdepartmental Collaboration: Collaborate closely with different departments to understand & meet their data & process requirements.
Report & Query Management: Build & maintain intricate reports & queries as needed, to ensure the availability of essential data for organizational processes & decision-making.
Data Management & Security: Safely import mass data between systems, ensuring data integrity, security, & compliance with relevant policies & regulations.
Project Management: Lead & oversee IT-related projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, & meet organizational goals.
Training: Lead & coordinate training sessions & creating manuals, ensuring team members are proficient & up to date with the latest system standards & best practices.
Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of the latest industry trends, tools, & best practices, ensuring the organization’s IT systems are cutting-edge & efficient.
Analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.


Job Requirements & Qualifications:


degree or equivalent experience, with preference for additional specialized certifications
Minimum 3 years of experience in IT systems management or a related role.
Experience in project management, ensuring the successful execution of IT initiatives.
Proficiency in CRM & EMR systems such as ClientTrack, TakeChargeTexas, eClinicalWorks, & E2Dallas or experience with similar database/software systems.
Ability to provide strategic input, troubleshoot advanced issues, & lead IT projects.
Strong verbal & written communication skills, with a detail-oriented & analytical mindset.
Familiarity with industry-specific software solutions & the ability to adapt to new tools.

Overview:
Veritex Community Bank is looking for an experienced Business/Systems Analyst to partner with PMO and Veritex business partners across Commercial & Consumer Lending, Credit Cards, Special Assets, Credit, and Treasury. The Business/Systems Analyst will serve as a liaison between Veritex team members, Technology, and 3rd party vendors as they implement process improvements and operational efficiencies across the bank.

In this role, the Business/Systems Analyst will be asked to analyze data and processes, problem solve, document project related information (project charter, business requirements, process workflows, test cases, etc.). Project related responsibilities include but are not limited to discovery, issue tracking, change management, testing, and additional needs as they arise in support of project efforts.


To succeed in this role, applicants should be a strong team player, have excellent time management, and communication skills. Although there will be independent work, this role focuses on collaboration with internal and external partners to deliver results on deadlines. The Business/Systems Analyst will support projects from concept to delivery and post-implementation.
Responsibilities:
Transform business requests into actionable deliverables (project charter, business requirements, process maps, costs/benefits, etc.)
Conduct stakeholder interviews and requirement sessions to capture and refine business requirements and targeted analysis.
Plan, schedule and facilitate meetings with business owners & SMEs
Record & distribute detailed meeting minutes
Track and monitor risks, issues, actions, and decisions
Obtain, analyze, and synthesize information from multiple business users to help distinguish request from needs
Become a product and/or, process subject matter expert
Develop and execute test plans and scripts, lead testing such as user acceptance and system integration
Act as liaison between business and technical members of the project, if needed
Ensure adherence to internal practices and standards resulting in consistent development and implementation of project components
Provide training and support to end users

Proven ability to build rapport and maintain relationships with internal partners at all levels within the organization
Ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Outstanding organizational and effective time management skills

5+ years of business/systems analyst experience required across one or more of the following project types: Business Process Reengineering, Strategy Transformation, Vendor Integration, SDLC projects
Proven work experience as a Business Analyst or Consultant from top tier management consulting, or similar role
Approaches work in a flexible, solution focused manner and is able to collaborate effectively with team members
Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision
Experience in data analysis, and general project management methods
Experience developing, leading, and executing test plans and scripts, including both user acceptance and system integration testing
An ability to prepare and interpret data, flowcharts, schedules and step-by-step action plans
Strong client-facing skills

Position Summary

The Director of Business Intelligence is a key member of the technology leadership team and serves as the Company’s analytics thought leader. This leader will develop, plan, and implement a technology strategy that delivers optimal returns on investment in coordination with the organization’s goals and core values with a focus on a “customer service” orientation.

Areas of responsibility include strategic leadership, team management, technical leadership around data management / ETL processes, end user reporting and analytics needs as well as project prioritization and management.

The Director will bring a track record of success in setting the strategic data and analytics direction in a multi-unit, franchised enterprise by driving innovation and building a competitive advantage based on strategic information.

The role is located in Addison, TX and this role requires the ability to be present in the office at least three days per week.




Key objectives

Lead the Business Intelligence team through data integration, storage, reporting, analytics, monitoring and compliance phases
Guide information strategy for customer, finance, marketing and other key data areas
Build and maintain Franchisee relationships; Earn respect of franchisees and cultivate strong relationships; navigate challenging situations with professionalism and confidence
Offer creative and practical solutions; Utilize creativity and innovation in problem solving and applying appropriate methodologies relevant to the complexity of the challenge
Understand future opportunities; Closely monitor changes with data technologies and identify ways the company can improve and implement plans to achieve these objectives
Maintain a high performing team; Continually assess and lead a talented, flexible, high performing BI function that has a high sense of urgency, is customer oriented, is responsive, and communicates effectively and manage the organization with a lean, ‘player / coach’ approach

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & DESIRED OUTCOMES




Serve as the thought leader, business partner and team mentor for the full data & analytics lifecycle

Collaborate with leadership to identify opportunities for leveraging data to gain a competitive advantage
Develop and execute the business intelligence strategy aligned with the organization's goals and objectives
Lead and manage BI team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement
Provide mentorship, coaching, and professional development opportunities to team members
Own BI‐related budgeting, planning and procurement, including developing business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for spending and initiatives
Oversee data integration processes, ensuring the extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of data from various sources to maintain a reliable data infrastructure
Ensure data pipelines are efficient, scalable, and maintain data integrity while optimizing priorities, delivery speed and related value-based spend
Ensure that data and analytics practices comply with relevant data protection and privacy regulations and security standards and protocols
Own and drive support processes around data / BI platforms, with an eye towards continuous improvement



IDEAL EXPERIENCE

Experience as BI/Analytics Director at a high growth company with a proven track record of high impact

Track-record of building and leading highly effective BI teams with a customer service and partnering mindset
Experience building strong stakeholder relationships across departments
Depth of experience selecting and implementing suitable technology for efficient data loading, governance and reporting capabilities required
Experience in building at a metrics-driven company (especially Private Equity owned) is ideal



PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS

Driving Results

Organized, urgent, and accountable: gets stuff done
Highly analytical mind-set; ROI and data-driven decision maker; has strong problem-solving and conceptual skills with the ability to quickly analyze and synthesize to support informed decision-making
Sets continually higher goals that are ambitious but realistic for self and team, geared to organizational objectives

Collaborating and Influencing

Presents effectively and persuasively with composure, building trust and credibility with various audiences
Excellent project management skills with the ability to balance multiple priorities and key stakeholders
Ability to work across the organization to get buy-in from the whole team on important initiatives and holds people accountable for results

Leading People

Collaborates and openly debates with the team to manage projects, solve problems, discuss challenging issues or learn more about critical issues as a group
Periodically reviews team progress against plans, focuses attention beyond the project to the full year and beyond



QUALIFICATIONS

15+ years of experience as BI/Analytics leader at growth companies with a proven track record of high impact
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
Strategic thinking and the ability to align BI initiatives with business objectives
Strong communication and presentation skills, with a focus on understanding and communicating the company’s core business
Strong leadership and management skills with the ability to motivate and guide a diverse team
Proficiency in BI tools such as Redshift, Snowflake, Tableau, QlikView, QuickSight or similar platforms
Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes
Experience in data visualization and statistical analysis
Knowledge of relevant data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and data security best practices
