It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field

We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:

20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees)

Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

Job Overview:


At Keurig Dr Pepper, our mission is to provide a beverage for every need, everywhere people shop and consume. With a portfolio of more than 125 iconic brands that consumers know and love, we are one of the largest food and beverage companies in the US. We keep the consumer at the heart of everything that we do, and that is why KDP holds strong leadership positions in most beverage categories.


We are looking for a Sales Planning and Analytics Analyst to lead our performance management and planning interface across our Mixers National Distributors sales team. This role will report directly to the head of MND sales and will support leading brands in the mixing space like Mr & Mrs T®, Roses®, Clamato® and Margaritaville®. You will have the opportunity to support iconic brands that are loved by millions of consumers, and your analytical and professional and thoughtful leadership will be instrumental in achieving outsized growth.


This position is based in our Frisco, TX office and will have a hybrid schedule (3 days in the office, 2 days work from home on a weekly basis)


What You’ll Do:

At KDP, we believe data, analytics, and process is the key to achieving ambitious sales goals. Our Sales Planning and Analytics Analysts are drivers of fact and process. They establish scorecards and dashboards that manage progress against priorities. They tell stories with data and use those abilities to inspire action. They are detail oriented and can devise and manage selling processes. In this role, you will:




Lead all reporting, forecasting, performance management and analysis across the mixers business to initiate sales actions.
Create and standardize scorecards and dashboards leveraged in internal and external reviews and selling discussions.
Support and facilitate connection points with key distributors and the content builds that support KDP’s agenda.
Conduct routine analysis that evaluates and monitors sales, distributor, account, and business performance.
Partner closely with stakeholders across sales, finance, revenue growth management, brand and customer teams
Requirements:


We are looking for leaders who have the drive and desire to make an impact, who are motivated by results, who thrive at working with diverse teams to tackle big challenges, and who have a true passion for our business.




BS/BA degree in a business discipline or equivalent experience
Experience with VIP depletions, IRI and other syndicated data providers
Advanced skills with PowerPoint and Excel required (e.g., Pivot Tables, V&H Lookups, Ifs, Sum ifs, Index, Match, VBA experience a plus)
Strong financial acumen and understanding of beverage sales. Spirits/Alcohol experience a plus
Analytical mindset and a commitment to continuous improvement, experience with problem solving with analytical thinking.
Interaction and guidance with Field Sales Reps around annual plan and strategies to win.
Supporting Field Sales around execution excellence of all Sales KPIs.
Company Overview & EEO Statement:
Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) is a modern beverage company with a bold vision built to deliver growth and opportunity. We operate with a differentiated business model and world-class brand portfolio, powered by a talented and engaged team that is anchored in our values. We work with big, exciting beverage brands and the #1 single-serve coffee brewing system in North America at KDP, and we have fun doing it!

Together, we have built a leading beverage company in North America offering hot and cold beverages together at scale. Whatever your area of expertise, at KDP you can be a part of a team that’s proud of its brands, partnerships, innovation, and growth. Will you join us?

We strive to be an employer of choice, providing a culture and opportunities that empower our team of ~28,000 employees to grow and develop. We offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development, while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work.

Keurig Dr Pepper is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. Keurig Dr Pepper recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability or association with a person with a disability, medical condition, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

About DerbySoft
Connecting different businesses together is what DerbySoft’s all about. We make the travel business easier by developing intelligent technology services delivering superior performance for our customers around the globe. We’re passionate about empowering companies to achieve their goals and transforming how companies interact with their customers.
DerbySoft has been recognized as a distinguished partner to the industry since 2002 offering strengths through exceptional technology and customer service with local operations globally.
We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours

Job Summary
Reporting to CEO, the Operations and Strategy Analyst is responsible for providing strategic direction, optimizing operation processes, and ensuring efficient and effective execution of the organization’s objectives. This role plays a pivotal part in decision-making, problem-solving, and driving growth and innovation, serving as the right-hand to the CEO and business unit presidents.

The Operations and Strategy Analyst is a critical position within the organization, contributing to DerbySoft’s long-term success and growth by aligning operations with strategic objectives and ensuring efficient execution. The role requires a combination of analytical thinking, leadership, and a deep understanding of the online travel industry and competitive landscape.

This position will share at least 80% KPIs with the CEO.

Key Responsibilities and Duties
Develop an annual strategy map, processes, and RACI with management team
Review and maintain company strategy map and business processes
Collaborate with executive leadership across departments, analyzing data driven insights to identify business opportunities and weak points and to support decision-making
Generate investment and improvement recommendations with clear expectations
Collaborate with executive leadership to formulate and achieve the company’s long-term and short-term goals
Monitor progress toward strategic goals and make adjustments as necessary
Analyze existing business processes and identify areas for improvement in order to enhance operational performance
Enhance workflow and cross-departmental engagements
Collaborate with the sales, product, and engineering teams to ensure proper resource allocation to support strategic initiatives and improve cost effectiveness across all platforms
Generate monthly reports for management to visualize data and trends
Keep updated on industry and market trends
Identify potential risks and challenges to the organization’s operations and strategy
Develop risk mitigation plans and contingency strategies
Ensure compliance with industry regulations and standards

Experience and Education
Master’s degree or above in mathematics, business, , management or a related field
Minimum 5 years as an analyst in a technology company
Strong business acumen
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Fluency in English is required, (reading, writing, speaking), fluency in Mandarin is a plus
Strong attention to detail
Excellent analytical skills
Good interpersonal skills to work with different management levels
In-depth knowledge of the online travel industry and market trends
Previous supervisory experience

Benefits
Generous Paid Time Off
Competitive Pay
Annual Bonus
Referral Bonus
Health, Dental & Vision Benefits
Company provided Life Insurance Program
Company provided Long – Term Disability Benefits
Voluntary Life
Employee Assistance Program
Company Matching Retirement Program

The Loan Doc & Proc Assoc Analyst is a developing professional role. This role identifies policy and applies specialty knowledge in monitoring and assessing processes and data. Integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Must be able to exchange information in a concise and logical way as well as be sensitive to audience diversity. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team. Individual must be accountable, ethical, results oriented, trustworthy, and credible. This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Responsibilities:

This role will manage preparing and reviewing loan documentation while providing support to a variety of tasks related to the loan process.
Activities will include independently processing and closing loans within a complex loan operations environment.
Involves in providing day-to-day loan transactional processing which may include booking cash transactions and making payments, performing loan reconciliations, input of general ledger entries and (complex) calculations
Possible interaction with other counterparties around positions and outstanding balances/claims
Supports an expansive and/or diverse array of products (risk and control) /services.
Follows established procedures to identify and resolve problems related to loan documentation/processing activities that require investigation or research.
Make recommendations to management to support process improvement.
Resolves problems by identifying and selecting solutions through the application of acquired technical experience and will be guided by precedents.
Designs and analyses moderately complex loan documentation reports to satisfy management requirements, support/control activities, and the launch of products/services.
Makes evaluative judgments based on the analysis of factual information, and provides assistance in the implementation of loan documentation process improvements.
Minimizes risk to the bank through increased knowledge of procedural requirements - understands and monitors errors to suggest solutions to reduce errors, and to adhere to audit and control policies. Often related, but not limited to loan documentation processes.
Timely management and escalation of all requests and issues related to loan processing
Has direct interaction with external customers to disseminate or explain information
Demonstrates an intermediate level of understanding of products and processes, and of how duties relate/integrate with others in the team and closely related teams
Demonstrates an excellent knowledge of Bank related systems
Utilizes communication, diplomacy and interpersonal skills to interact with colleagues and stakeholders, and to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information, while sensitive to audience diversity
Individuals at this level exhibit executional capabilities
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behaviour, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:

0-2 years of experience
Basic knowledge of Business Processes, Systems and Tools used in the Loan Process
Demonstrate understanding of Loan Processes, Procedures, Products and Services
General awareness of managing, preparing, and reviewing loan documentation
Able to identify, mitigate, manage, resolve, and escalate risks and issues
Awareness of risk types, policies and control measures and processes
Comply with applicable laws, rules, and regulations, and adhering to Policies

Education:

Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience

Job Posting:

English (US) THE ROLE AND THE COMPANY

Heidelberg Materials provides the materials to build our future. Our future is sustainable. Our future is digital. And it goes way beyond cement, aggregates and ready-mixed concrete. Heidelberg Materials North America, previously known as Lehigh Hanson, operates more than 450 locations with approximately 9,000 employees in the U.S. and Canada.

We are seeking a qualified Strategy and Development Analyst for its Irving (Las Colinas), TX location. The position of Strategy and Development Analyst will be responsible for developing a wide variety of analyses and documents that will be used by the senior management of Heidelberg Materials and the Strategy and Development team. The candidate will also support the Competence Center Logistics for 20% of their time. The candidate must be able to build positive working relationships with managers and employees throughout the Company and to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. The candidate must have a strong working knowledge of market research, financial statements, and strategic planning.

What You’ll Get to Do

Prepare comprehensive analyses of the economic, demographic, and competitive landscapes of current and potential markets as well as financial projection of businesses and projects.
Aid in assessing financial and strategic attractiveness and pursuing attractive opportunities, including organic growth projects as well as joint ventures, swaps, divestitures, mergers, and acquisitions.
Convert information and analyses into actionable decision frameworks and summary presentations for senior management.
Assist in creating strategies and plans to drive revenue growth, value enhancement and cost optimization.
Support the Strategy and Development Department with all aspects of strategic development job duties.

Essential Experience and Skills

BA/BS degree with a major or focus in finance, business, economics, quantitative analysis, research or operations preferred.
2 to 4 years relevant professional experience gained in the building materials industry or a position in market research, consulting, M&A, operations, or finance.
Superior problem solving, financial, research and analytical skills.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Work well in a team and independently.
Proven ability to think creatively and strategically.
Demonstrated drive, initiative, and adaptability.
Excellent presentation skills and attention to detail.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office products, including Excel, PowerPoint, Access, and Word.

What We Have to Offer:

Competitive base salary and participation in our annual incentive plan
Competitive benefits program
401k retirement savings plan with an automatic company contribution as well as matching contributions

No Search Firms please.

The Role : Business Analyst, Agile & PPM Tools

The Team :
The Agile & PPM Tools team is responsible for developing and managing enterprise tools enabling Agile Execution (Azure DevOps), Project Portfolio Management (Solution Business Manager) and Reporting (Tableau), for all the S&P Global Divisions. These tools are used across S&P for Portfolio Management capabilities like prioritizing, executing and tracking Portfolios, Agile Workflow Execution to enable Agile delivery and Portfolio & Agile Analytics.

The Impact :
Are you looking for an opportunity to advance your career as an innovative enterprise team member? The Agile & PPM Tools Team is looking for an innovative professional who can bring teamwork, creativity, and business analyst experience to a global team.

What’s in it for you :
As a Business Analyst, Agile & PPM Tools, you will have the opportunity to work closely with senior stakeholders from all the divisions and showcase your ability to tackle multiple assignments with ease and gracefully absorb changes as they present themselves. Overall goal of the Team is to develop and support a common Enterprise toolset for all divisions to enable Portfolio Management, resourcing, execution, and reporting with cutting edge technologies like Azure DevOps, AWS Cloud Systems (S3, EC2, RDS etc), AWS Services (Lambda, Glue, S3, Redshift etc), Databricks as well as Market leaders in PPM and Agile tools.

Responsibilities :
In the day-to-day operations, you will be a part of the Agile & PPM Tools Scrum team and will support our internal customers which include users from across the S&P Global Enterprise at all levels from senior leadership to individual users. You will also facilitate communication between our users and our Business and Scrum team members who manage and deliver solutions on these platforms. With your acute investigation, troubleshooting and communication skills, you will be championing support best practices and improving our user’s experience. Some of your areas of ownership will include:

Agile & PPM Tools Engineering Team (Scrum Team):
Support our customers on the requests raised by them on our ticketing platform - Service Now
Troubleshoot and service customer requests focusing on maximum customer satisfaction
Liaison with end customer to Support and advance tools adoption.
Share knowledge with peers and foster a cohesive self-organized team environment
Provide feedback to help the Business and Development teams to create high-value products
Escalates and tracks issues with appropriate levels within the team
Build a deep understanding of the solutions delivered on both platforms to understand utility from our users/customers perspective
Keep up to date on support and customer experience best practices and suggest or implement improvements in processes or tools

What We’re Looking For :
Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Technology, Engineering or related area
0-3 years of relevant work experience with Web based Applications
Proven willingness to learn, a positive attitude, and an ability to work in a fast-paced, high demand work environment
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal and the ability to investigate and summarize technical concepts clearly and succinctly
Highly organized, independent and multitasker
Good data analysis skills using Excel and any other BI tools
Knowledge of Agile Execution tools like Azure DevOps, JIRA etc.
Experience using any Workflow Management tool like ServiceNow, Solutions Business Manager, VersionOne, etc.
Demonstrable experience in facilitating, leading, influencing, and managing within large-scale matrix, globally distributed organizations
Open to working flexible hours as per business needs

Preferred Qualifications :
SAFe or Agile Certification
Prior experience managing a low code platform
Experience with AWS Systems and Services
Experience on PPM tools like Solutions Business Manager (Micro Focus Tool) and/or Agile
Execution tools like Azure DevOps (Microsoft tool)

Job Grade : 8

The Location : Dallas, TX

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is not eligible for additional compensation such as an annual incentive bonus or sales commission plan.

Summary:

Situated within the Business Optimization group, our Lead Analyst plays a pivotal role in enhancing our strategic enterprise initiatives. This team is dedicated to fostering cross-functional alignment, seamless collaboration, and the efficient delivery of enterprise programs. Utilizing best-in-class integration management practices, we drive transformative business results. As a core member of the Enterprise Program Management workstream, the Lead Analyst is entrusted with the coordination, facilitation, and oversight of projects underpinning our major enterprise programs.

Key to this role is the deep dive into analysis, consistent project monitoring, meticulous tracking, and comprehensive reporting. Our Lead Analyst works together with essential business stakeholders, IT departments, and project/program teams, ensuring that all endeavors align with and achieve our business goals. This role offers a unique opportunity to work closely with both the Business Optimization leadership and influential business leaders across our organization. Through this collaboration, the incumbent will cultivate and sustain enduring professional relationships with key stakeholders.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Steer the full lifecycle of multiple projects, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives and timely delivery.
Develop, manage, and monitor essential project documentation, such as project schedules, plans, risk and issues logs, and status reports.
Collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders to establish project scope, timelines, and deliverables.
Identify, escalate, and address key project challenges through structured tracking and strategic resolution processes.
Offer support and insights to other Project Managers, promoting a cohesive approach to business objectives.
Work closely with stakeholders to gather, document, and validate business requirements, ensuring their alignment with project objectives.
Lead key business process discussions, solution design, and documentation, ensuring rigorous testing and comprehensive end-user support.
Contribute as a vital team member on diverse Enterprise Projects, infusing business analytical expertise to guarantee project success.
Build and nurture influential cross-functional relationships across the organization, emphasizing collaboration.
Serve as a primary contact for project and program inquiries, promoting clear and open channels of communication.

Requirements:

Education and/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, or related field
Proven experience as a Project Manager and Business Analyst
Strong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and meet deadlines
Ability to interact with internal and external customers as well as all levels of management
Excellent written and oral communication skills

Minimum Experience:

8 years of relevant experience functioning as a project manager and business analyst role
Ability to interact with internal and external customers as well as all levels of management
Able to set and conduct management routines to keep teams on track with established, aggressive timelines
Sharep analytical, problem-solving, and organization skills
Excelletn interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to manage mnultiple projects with a keen attention to detail.

Preferred Experience:

Prior work with within the oil & gas industry
Experience working in a Program or Project office as an analyst or project manager preferred
PMP Certification with current / working knowledge and experience, preferred
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools
Knowledge of project management methodologies and experience with process improvement initiatives

Working Conditions:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

Usually, normal office working conditions.
Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time due to prolonged periods of sitting or standing.
Up to 15% overnight travel may be required.
Occasional visits to industrial/manufacturing settings, which may include exposure to various materials and chemicals, as well as extreme temperature conditions and loud machinery, and require appropriate personal protective equipment.

Provide update or refresher training to team, as needed.

Exceptional management, organization, presentation and negotiation skills

Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst, Academic & Business Operations
Job Description:
Why UT Southwestern?

With over 75 years of excellence in Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas, UT Southwestern is committed to excellence, innovation, teamwork, and compassion. At UT Southwestern, we invest in you with opportunities for career growth and development that align with your future goals and help to provide security for you and your family. Our highly competitive benefits package offers healthcare, PTO and paid holidays, on-site childcare, wage, merit increases and so much more that are all available on the day you start work. UT Southwestern is honored to be a Veteran Friendly work environment that is home to approximately 800 veterans. We value your integrity, dedication, and the commitment you’ve made to our country. We’re proud to support your next mission. Ranked by Forbes as one of the Top 10 National Employers, we invite you to be a part of the UT Southwestern team where you’ll discover teamwork, professionalism, and consistent opportunities for growth.
Job Summary

UT Southwestern Medical Center is hiring for Senior Financial Analyst, Academic & Business Operations

Academic & Business Operations is actively seeking a highly motivated and career-minded individual to join our Operations team as a Senior Financial Analyst with Healthcare experience. In this exciting position, you will be responsible for a range of activities, including institutional compensation and productivity analysis, multiple system development and reporting initiatives, and a vast array of complex ad-hoc analyses required of the office/role. You will liaison with a range of academic leadership position, and be challenged to prepare complex deliverables at an executive level.

This role offers a hybrid work arrangement, combining the benefit of both remote and in-office work environment (two(2) days in office, (3) days remote, subject to change).

Experience and Education

Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or other related field and four (4) years progressively responsible experience in finance and/or accounting with experience in planning, forecasting, and financial analysis.
Job Duties

Completes variety of complex monthly financial management reports and reviews all reports for errors and inconsistencies; analyzes variations in forecasts and actual performance; determines reasons for variance; develops recommendations for improvement; completes written summaries of financial data.
Prepares and/or supervises preparation of monthly financial reports, schedules for annual financial reports, and reports to various government agencies, ensuring conformance of such reports with applicable procedures and regulations of University of Texas System and Federal and State agencies.
Identifies areas of poor performance, presents findings, and makes recommendations to upper management.
Prepares financial models and conducts financial analyses.
May maintain controls for policies and procedures for financial system; develops and maintains delegation of authority of various procedures, such as check requests, refunds, invoice approval, bad debt write-offs, etc.
Completes more complex special projects as requested.
**Other Duties: Performs other duties as assigned.

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Position Summary

The Clinical Client Operations - Analyst will be responsible for analyzing Client's specialty benefit requests and inputting data into RxClaim to maintain specialty benefits (pricing, co-pays, grace fills, etc.) and building of new Specialty benefits for clients. The Analyst's duties will emphasize data analysis and review of client documentation to determine client intent for their specialty benefit. Analysis will be completed using RxClaim and analytical tools (i.e. MS Excel and MS Access) in support of specialty builds and maintenance. Other duties will include RxClaim query, data analysis, manual updates to RxClaim, testing changes using EZ- Test and macros and reviewing test claims for accuracy. The Analyst will also use SalesForce to track work and monitor TAT. The Analyst will confirm client intent when necessary and ensure complete client documentation is included with all request.


Required Qualifications
1 year prior work experience in Microsoft applications, RxClaim Coding, RxClaim Query/EZ Query

Preferred Qualifications
SalesForce.com Experience
Certified Pharmacy Technician Experience

Education High School Diploma or GED required
Bachelor Degree preferred

$40,600.00 - $83,400.00

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst (Full Time) - Sugar Land or Dallas
Job Description:
POSITION PURPOSE

Will work with the Business Intelligence team focused on providing solutions to complex business problems through the configuration, integration, testing and support of our software applications. This role requires project management experience and a strong technical background. This Business Analyst serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. It requires a blend of analytical skills as well as extensive user interaction and great interpersonal skills.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES

Analyzes business partner's operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions
Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology
Translates high-level business requirements into functional specifications for the BI team and manages changes to such specifications
Update, implement and maintain procedures
Perform some User Acceptance Testing
Assist in the definition of project scope and success criteria
Prepares business cases including cost/benefit analysis for proposed processes
Develops reports and documents for existing business processes and business rules
Adheres to IT policies and procedures and industry accepted practice
Conducts post implementation review and document goal attainment

QUALIFICATIONS
Education/Certification: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information systems or equivalent. Project management certification a plus.

Required Knowledge

Experience in business analysis in an Agile environment.
Experience with agile work organizations tools (Azure DevOps, Basecamp).
Have a solid understanding of software development life cycles.
Strong technical background allowing to provide credible leadership to the BI
team and accurately evaluate complex project risks and issues.
A solid understanding of how APIs and databases function at a high level.
Experience creating functional requirements and use cases.
Experience implementing technology applications.
Excellent organizational and analytical skills are essential.

Experience Required

7+ years of experience as a Business Analyst
3+ years managing and/or leading IT project implementations
3-5 years of experience in financial/banking industry a plus

Skills/Abilities

Must be flexible and willing to adapt to changes and can establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff and other departments/agencies.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Excellent documentation skills.
Must be willing to work after-hours
Must work well in a team environment
Must be able to interface with users and vendors
Must have sense of urgency and ownership to support financial applications, with architectural and system component knowledge preferred
Proficiency in interpersonal communication, presentation, problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously with attention to detail and accuracy.
Must be a self-starter that is driven to understand and complete tasks within the guidelines and timeframes assigned.

Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM.
40 hours per week

Job Summary
Reporting to the Assistant Director for Systems Operations, the 3rd Party Systems Administrator is responsible for third-party system configuration and maintenance. This includes enabling and setting up system configurations, evaluating integrations, supporting system upgrades, optimizing existing configurations, troubleshooting issues, and producing system configuration documentation.
Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in related field
Three (3) years or more experience working as an application administrator to maintain configurations, understand integrations, configure new features, review system upgrade information, and optimize system configurations.
Three (3) years or more experience providing customer service to troubleshoot issues and assist with system configuration changes.
Six (6) months or more experience working as a business analyst, financial analyst, data analyst, or in a comparable role within a business unit utilizing an ERP or third-party application.
Equivalent combination of experience/education may be considered.
Preferred Education and Experience
Five to seven years of experience working as an application administrator to maintain configurations, understand integrations, configure new features, review system upgrade information, and optimize system configurations
Five to seven years in customer service to troubleshoot issues and assist with system configuration changes
One year to three years of experience working as a business analyst, financial analyst, data analyst, or in a comparable role within a business unit
Master’s degree in a related field
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Provide administrative support and system maintenance for third-party applications (configurations, access updates, data issues, workflow updates, liaison with third-party applications contacts)
Analyze and review system data to maintain timeliness of system operations and identify any possible issues or areas of improvement
Troubleshoot production data and configuration issues related to third party applications
Provide third-party system data and configuration support during system upgrades
Produce job aids and training documentation for third-party systems
Work with stakeholders and module owners to optimize and troubleshoot third-party system configurations
Assist stakeholders, module owners, and business process analysts with understanding integrations between the third-party applications and the ERP system
Generate reports from third-party applications to provide data to functional areas
Participate in enhancement projects involving third-party systems

home office. In this role you will contribute to Korn Ferry’s growth and profitability goals by delivering best-in-class support
services to our clients and colleagues. Working cross functionally with Korn Ferry managers; client; and Korn Ferry RPO
team leaders and recruiters to providing advanced reporting and analytics to ensure delivery standards are maintained and
continually drive process improvements.

The Reporting Analyst will:

Create Reports, provide Analytics and develop Presentations
Ensure all internal and external reporting related to the recruitment process is accurate, complete, and delivered
against pre-established deadlines

Conduct ad hoc quality checks to ensure completeness and accuracy of data added to the systems
Leverage expertise in data analysis, compliance, and quality reporting to ensure a streamlined process

each account

recruitment objectives

Process Improvement & Escalation

Proactively identify opportunities for improvement and make constructive suggestions for process or procedural
change, including change management steps
Anticipate and minimize risks, offer suggestions for solutions

Escalate and resolve issues in a timely fashion

Relationship-building
Build and maintain solid relationships with key client stakeholders
Communicate effectively with internal and external clients including
Set and manage expectations

Project Management

Prepare and actively participate in regular project reviews with client
Effectively communicate relevant project information to leadership
Collaborate with internal client account team and across lines of business to identify continued opportunities for
account expansion and Korn Ferry solution integration

Skills and Experience

Ability to go onsite to 2101 Cedar Springs Road, Dallas TX 75201 as required
High School Diploma Required
Minimum 3+ years of relevant experience in reporting analytics and designing presentations in a customer-focused
environment
Advanced skills in Google docs and other systems
Prior/current experience and familiarity with recruitment and delivery metrics (ideally within an RPO environment)
Proven track record of developing and managing measurable and understandable analytics that surpass
contractable obligations
Experience working in a service delivery environment and establishing mutually agreeable goals-metrics-KPI’s that
will allow Korn Ferry’s clients to effectively utilize our RPO team
Comfortable presenting analytical reports to senior management
Excellent planning and organizing skills; able to “juggle” responsibilities effectively in a high volume, fast-paced
service environment
Excellent customer relationship skills

Ability to analyze fairly complex data and develop sound recommendations and solutions

What we’re looking for

At AppFolio, we paddle as one. We ride and make waves together, with a relentless focus on building great products for the way our customers work and live today – and tomorrow. AppFolio is a destination organization where careers are made and accelerated. Here, innovation is a team sport.

Your impact

Identify and spearhead continuous improvement initiatives utilizing technology and process automation; drive process improvements and systems solutions, gain buy-in from team members and leadership

Drive CRM requirements alignment across the organization; help build and establish scalable processes and explore appropriate automation opportunities, reporting applications to fully leverage technology and tools

Project manage initiatives, providing coordination and alignment cross functionally between stakeholders. This includes requirements definition, cross-functional coordination, resource planning & budgeting, and delivery against key milestones

Experience leading financial systems implementations including requirements gathering, design, build, test and roll-out; with the project planning/management and documentation skills

Strong leadership and project management skills including effective communication, facilitation, ability to build and drive cross-functional partnerships

Job Summary
The Operations Analyst will support the Ops team in developing, sourcing, and reporting key operational metrics and data analysis. This person will be responsible for performing research, analysis, and reporting on data around new initiatives. The Operations Analyst will assist in the coordination of all finance and business planning related functions including routine analysis, reporting, budgeting, and providing resource support.

What you will do in this role
Develop and monitor operational performance forecast and recommend solutions based upon analyses performed.
Incorporate data from multiple internal and external sources and communicate results to leadership.
Manage individual provider issues as well as requests for data on facility and provider productivity.
Respond to custom request for support and analysis on new metrics, projects, and initiatives.
Review ongoing accounting month close, accruals, payroll, billing processes, etc.
Proactively prepare/assist with P&L statements to develop and maintain a monthly dashboard of key operational performance indicators. Reconcile monthly financial performance vs. budget. Prepare data for all administration finance functions, including monthly financial and statistical reports. Present findings to senior leadership.
Act as a liaison between administration, other hospital departments, and anesthesia practices.
Prepare, maintain, and present analyses request for senior leadership as required.
Source, test, and report key operational metrics for the organization’s operations.
Partner with key business stakeholders to identify project requirements by analyzing operations, determining scope, and documenting results.
What qualifications you will need
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Healthcare, Economics, or related field is required.
1-3 years’ experience in financial planning, business operations, or financial reporting is strongly preferred.
Healthcare experience is a plus.
Equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.
Proficient in all Microsoft Office.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
Ability to understand key issues, operations, and synthesize complex information to communicate to various audience.
Fast growing. Dynamic team culture. Your chance to shine.
As a corporate employee in the healthcare field, you understand that our industry is changing rapidly, and you want to be a part of those positive changes. Founded in 2004 by an anesthesiologist and a CRNA, NorthStar Anesthesia is the fastest growing anesthesia management company in the country, and we have built a foundation of anesthesia expertise unparalleled in the market. Our corporate culture emphasizes collaboration, appreciation, mutual respect, and accountability. We put patients at the center of everything we do; and our corporate team works to support our clinicians so that they can provide world class anesthesia care.


"The best part about working at NorthStar is the people. In my opinion, we have some of the most knowledgeable, innovative, and hard-working professionals in healthcare. Across all departments, clinical and non-clinical, I have always been impressed with the talent within our organization. " - Landon Owens, Sr. Director of Talent Acquisition and Strategy

Join NorthStar as an Operations Analyst and invest in your career! Apply today and a member of our Talent Acquisition team will follow up with you.

Description

This is a unique opportunity to join our fast-growing team in Gartner’s Global Product Management organization. Here you’ll work with a group of data scientists, engineers, UX designers and other product managers to drive significant business impact to client retention. Our mission is to create effortless, customer-centric, habit-forming digital experiences that enable clients to solve their mission critical priorities. The Associate Product Manager plays a critical role in driving analysis, ideation, requirements, and implementation of enhancements to our Client Experience Notifications product, the company’s #1 driver of client digital engagement.

We are looking for an analytic-minded, creative-thinking, impact-driven, self-motivated, data-storytelling problem solver. The successful candidate will assist other product manager teammates with analysis as well as own their own projects. This is an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of our efforts to drive client engagement as well as Gartner’s revenue growth and retention.

What You Will Do

Ideate, size, scope, execute and analyze enhancements to our Client Experience Notifications product suite’s Email Notifications to drive quantifiably impact to client satisfaction and thereby retention rates.
Leverage qualitative feedback from client and partner interviews to uncover user needs through exploratory and focused conversations.
Mine quantitative data to drive insights, inform hypotheses, prioritize development and size opportunity.
Build consensus amongst product leaders, engineering, and business on prioritizing the product roadmap based on client and business value.
Implement a “lean” approach to product development where you – along with your design and engineering teams – strive for early validation of learnings and continuously iterate to achieve our goals.
Direct efforts for email template design, content management, audience building, delivery setup and analysis.
Participate with your scrum team in sprints to build a product roadmap, define MVP functionality, collect user feedback, and analyze the results.

What You Will Need

Bachelor’s degree required; MBA (or equivalent) is a plus.
1+ years of experience working as a business analyst or digital product manager.
Love quantitative/qualitative problem solving and are excited about defining and driving use cases, product features/requirements, roadmaps, and release plans through data.
Experience in gathering input from and communicating ideas to clients and key stakeholders across businesses.

About the Role



Do you want to influence how the largest commercial real estate company in the world manages its business? If so, CBRE is seeking a dynamic Senior Financial Analyst to join their team at their corporate headquarters located in Dallas, Texas.



Responsible for supporting accounting, analysis and reporting activities associated with benefit and compensation programs (an annual spend over $1Bn approx.) for a population of over 115,000 employees (35% US) based in over 70 countries. Serve as the finance partner for the People (HR) Global Benefits and US Payroll organization and support the financial planning and segment-regional-local controllership teams. The ideal candidate must be solution-oriented and be able to communicate effectively across finance and non-finance functions.



What You'll Do



Support the accounting and operations for US and Global benefit and compensation programs including payroll and its related transactions.



Assist the benefits and compensation (as applicable) areas for the monthly close which includes coordinating with Segment Accounting Teams, Business Finance, People Teams, and the Shared Services Organization.



Conduct bank reconciliations and ensure accuracy of financial data.



Conduct moderate to complex reconciliations and ensure accuracy and completeness of data flowing thru various stages to ultimately general ledger.



Assist in the preparation of budgets, forecasts, and financial reports.



Accountable for complying and continually improving accounting and reporting processes.



Contribute to key accounting projects and deliverables to ensure reporting accuracy and that departmental deadlines are met.



Assist the Benefits and Compensation team in meeting the organization’s internal and external auditors on accounting matters.



Assist in the preparation of key internal financial reports; including the partnering with Business Finance (Financial Planning) to explain variances.



Maintain compliance with U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.



What You'll Need

To perform this job optimally, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.



Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.



Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from a four-year college or university in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration. CPA or MBA (graduate degree) preferred, but not required. 3+ years related experience.



Preferable to have payroll / Benefits experience.



Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable, and courteous service to customers. Ability to optimally present information to finance management.



Understanding of GAAP, Financial Accounting Standards (FASB), theories, & practices.



Demonstrate reasonable experience & knowledge of financial issues & economic impact beyond technical knowledge.



Good understanding of financial terms and principles.



Ability to analyze the moderate to complex business/financial data and develop innovative solutions. Ability to forecast and prepare budgets.



Conduct financial/business analysis including the preparation of reports. Understanding of accounting and bookkeeping concepts.



Require strong knowledge of financial terms, concepts and accounting principles and the ability to comprehend and interpret complex financial transactions.



Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret moderate to complex financial information and transactions and accounting principles. Requires analytical and quantitative skills.



Strong computer skills, including specific knowledge of Microsoft Office with emphasis on Excel (+ Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.).



Broad experience with large financial systems such as Oracle, PeopleSoft, Hyperion, etc. is desired. Knowledge of real estate service industry and terminology is helpful.



Self-motivated, strong work ethic and able to work independently with minimal supervision.



Strong analytical and problem resolution skills, including the ability to research and simplify complex situations.



Ability to work with various levels of the organization to collect information and drive resolution.



Must be detail-oriented, have a proactive approach and the ability to work with cross-functional teams.



Must be able to optimally handle and prioritize critical deadlines.



Ability to work in a team environment.



Why CBRE?




A culture of respect, integrity, service and excellence crafts our approach to every opportunity.



We are guided by the needs of the cities we inhabit, the communities we build and the world we live in.

Description:

MISSION

Our mission is to enhance well-being by connecting individuals with vital health resources through a compassionate workforce that embodies the spirit of neighbors helping neighbors.

VALUES

HealthOne is guided by a cultural framework that embodies our values and drives our decisions.

Our PURPOSE is to care for people by connecting them to resources that help protect them in health related situations. To fulfill our purpose, we align our PRIORITIES to ensure each decision we make is ethical, empathetic, economical, and efficient. We care for PEOPLE by being welcoming, authentic, truthful, consistent and humble. We are continuously looking for ways to improve our PROCESS and how we get things done.

HealthOne seeks individuals with integrity and heart to embody our values. Whether you’re starting your career or looking to develop additional skills to reach your full potential, HealthOne provides the means to help you achieve your goals.

JOB PURPOSE

The IT Business Analyst will be a vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features. The IT Business Analyst reviews, analyzes, and evaluates user needs to create systems solutions that support overall business strategies. The incumbent also documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives, and assists in the creation of system specifications that drive system development and implementation. This position is a liaison between IT and users and have both business and technical expertise.

Requirements:

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

Understands business requirements and produces requirement specification documents
Creates application design documents
Understands and follows the company’s software development life cycle process
Reports on common sources of technical issues or questions and makes recommendations to product team
Works closely with project team to maintain a continuous knowledge of project status in order to identify potential issues and/or opportunities
Ensures client issues are dealt with in an efficient manner, informing all parties of any outstanding issues or problems
Communicates client's goals and represents client's interests to the team
Continuously finds ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
Performs quality assurance
Defines reporting and alerting requirements
Owns and develops relationships with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our solutions
Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities
Maintains documentation in CRM tool
Regular and predictable attendance
Consistently demonstrates compliance with HIPAA regulations, professional conduct, and ethical practice
Works to encourage and promote Company culture throughout the organization
Other duties as may be assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in related field or commensurate work experience
Previous experience in Business/Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance
Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
Ability to work under pressure and meet project deliver dates
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-related conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
Basic knowledge in writing SQL queries
Solid experience in generating process and screen design documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Word and Excel

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Moderate to significant amount of stress in meeting deadlines and dealing with day-to-day responsibilities. Must be able to drive a vehicle and daytime/overnight travel as required.

BENEFITS

401K (4% Match, Immediate Vesting)

Accident insurance

Competitive salary

Critical Illness Insurance

Dental Insurance

Employee Assistance Program

Flexible Spending Account

Health & Wellness Program

Health Savings Account

Life & AD&D Insurance

Long Term Disability

Medical Insurance

Paid Time Off

Pet Insurance

Short Term Disability

Vision Insurance

PRE-EMPLOYMENT SCREENING

Drug Screen and Background Check Required

HEALTHONE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

With an unmatched reach at the national and local level, Gannett touches the lives of millions with our Pulitzer Prize-winning content, consumer experiences and benefits, and advertiser products and services.

Our current portfolio of media assets includes The USA TODAY NETWORK, which includes USA TODAY, and local media organizations in 43 states in the United States, and Newsquest, a wholly-owned subsidiary operating in the United Kingdom. The Publisher Technical Operations (PTO) Analyst Job requires individuals with exceptional analytical focus, attention to detail, and technical curiosity. This role is key to the continued successful integration between LocaliQ’s proprietary platform and well-established internet ad networks. PTO Analysts are expected to work effectively in a group setting and are measured on both the performance of the team and their impact within the team. PTO Analysts must be flexible and be able to multitask across a large scope of duties and activities:

Manage, document, troubleshoot, and resolve issues related to advertising efforts between LocaliQ platforms and the publishers with which LocaliQ partners
Identification and communication of publisher and platform issues to the sales and campaign services groups
Publisher policy, process, and procedure expert with heavy focus in all publisher verifications and certifications to ensure minimal revenue impact
Assessing and documenting publisher editorial requirements to prevent and resolve editorial issues directly or by communicating the proper editorial standards to the advertiser and/or sales and campaign professional teams
Daily Monitoring and analysis of platform and publisher performance to determine trends, opportunities, and problems
Analyze changing guidelines and API messages to maintain internal consistency with publisher requirements
Communicate directly with Google, Bing, Yahoo, and other publishers when an error on their part is found, or when day to day operations deem it necessary
Create reports that drive needed changes in the product and engineering org
Participate in semiweekly trainings that grow knowledge of web publishers as well as more in depth looks into database structure, software tools, etc
Key Skills

Proficient use of Microsoft Office applications including Microsoft Excel and Word
Basic understanding of web technologies (html, css, js) recommended
Some MySQL experience recommended
Minimum 2 years of experience working in major internet advertising publisher platforms including, but not limited to, Google Ads and Microsoft Ads
Minimum 2 years of experience with LocaliQ’s proprietary “Admin” platforms for better job assimilation
Quickly and accurately scope work to determine cost benefit
Competencies

Advanced Problem Solving
The ability to not only resolve the symptoms of an issue, but to identify the source of the issue (root cause analysis) and prevent future incidents
Applying knowledge about current standards, policies, and processes to resolve new issues that arise as a result of new & current publisher relationships.

Priority setting
Able to quickly identify those issues whose resolution will have the maximum positive impact on the advertising effort for our advertisers.
Use available evidence and applied knowledge to identify patterns in issues that may point to a larger issues whose resolution would improve overall campaign performance.
The ability to monitor budgets, understand return-on-investment (ROI) as a decision making tool, and select and analyze relevant data to determine and prioritize resolution.

Technical learning
Can learn new skills and knowledge quickly
Good understanding of technical tools used, like ticketing systems, CRM software, and survey methods.

Problem solving
Spots hidden problems and possesses effective analytical skills
Looks beyond symptoms –works to determine root/cause of problem
Uses applied knowledge, available evidence, logical means and processes to investigate and resolve problems with a high degree of accuracy

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree
3+ years of experience in Marketing, Advertising, Public Relations, Customer Service or related field
Minimum of 24 months with LocaliQ

JOB DESCRIPTION


The Agile Enablement Lead plays a pivotal role in driving the Corporate Technology agility transformation. This position uniquely combines the analytical skills of a business analyst, the persuasive and clear communication of a corporate communications specialist, and the innovative approach of a marketer. A key aspect of this role will be the ability to use effective communication strategies to drive organization-wide change. The successful candidate will be comfortable communicating at all levels of the organization, adept at managing change, and able to bring thought leadership to the table.

Responsibilities:

Lead and influence the business agility transformation within the organization, using effective communication strategies to promote and drive change.
Evaluate current business operations using strong business analysis skills, identify opportunities for improvement, and implement changes as needed.
Develop and implement communication strategies that inform, engage, and motivate employees and other stakeholders throughout the agility transformation process.
Craft clear, compelling messages about our agility transformation for various audiences, including leadership, employees, and external stakeholders.
Apply a marketing mindset to operational issues, finding creative ways to promote and embed agility within the organization.
Contribute to the development and delivery of training materials and workshops to build agility capability within the organization.
Work collaboratively with various departments to facilitate the transition to more agile ways of working.
Monitor and evaluate the impact of agility initiatives, communicating progress and results effectively to all stakeholders.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, communications, or related field.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in business operations, marketing, communications, or a related role.
Experience driving agile transformations or implementing agile principles in a business setting.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret business data.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively lead change management initiatives and explain complex concepts to diverse audiences.
Innovative mindset with a track record of driving change and influencing organizational culture.
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of teams and stakeholders.

Why join Stryker?
We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com


As the Senior Business Analyst - CPQ, you will form partnerships with business users across departments and build expertise that will help you prioritize, gather, and document Oracle CPQ requirements related to new configurable product launches, current configurable product updates, continuous improvement initiatives, and clarifying requirements to implement bug fixes.

Who We Want

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, data and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions.

Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

Effective communicators. People who can interpret information clearly and accurately to concisely communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders, senior management, and their teams.

What You Will Do

Requirements gathering, testing, and documentation of Oracle CPQ Product Configuration, Commerce, Document Designer, and Pricing Functions focusing on the addition of new product lines to an existing Oracle CPQ Cloud implementation, documenting Sales Bill of Material requirements and Manufacturing Bill of Material requirements.
Work with business department stakeholders, prioritizes enhancement requests related to Oracle CPQ and SAP Variant Configurator.
Consult with Sales, Marketing, Production, and R&D Project managers on specific product line needs.
Learn Stryker’s implementation of Oracle CPQ and becomes a subject matter expert of CPQ end user functionality.
Review upcoming Oracle CPQ Cloud version release notices and collaborates with the CPQ development team to document the required changes.
Collaborate with internal developers and external consultants to create project plans and participate in unit testing and End User Testing.
Lead business process mapping and requirements gathering sessions with business stakeholders.
Work with middleware teams to document interfaces in and out of CPQ in clear and concise business language.
Track CPQ project progress and reports status, issues, and roadblocks to the responsible R&D project manager for a new product launch.
Share industry best practices around Configure-to-Order systems and business processes.
Drive continuous process improvement activities and initiatives.

What You Need

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent required.
2+ years of relevant experience.
Knowledge of Product Configuration & Rules, Commerce Process, Document Designer and Pricing functionality of Oracle CPQ Cloud or other CPQ systems required.
Experience developing Oracle CPQ Configurators is preferred but not required.
Experience administering Oracle CPQ (formerly BigMachines) preferred.
Experience building manufacturing bills of material using SAP Variant Configurator preferred.
Demonstrated understanding of commercial processes and manufacturing processes including Assemble-to-Order and the differentiation between Sales BOMs and Manufacturing BOMs preferred.
Knowledge of Oracle CPQ integrations with Salesforce.com, Model N and SAP S/4 preferred.

Overview:
Who we are

Imagine working in a place where continuous improvement and innovation is celebrated and rewarded; where fast-paced, high-impact teams come together to positively drive results for one of the largest & most iconic brands in the world.


As the only rapidly growing retailer, you may know us as your friendly neighborhood store. You probably know our familiar name, have seen our pervasive logo, and have tried our highly sought-after products, such as Slurpee® and Big Bite®. “Brain Freeze” is a 7-Eleven registered trademark for our 53-year old Slurpee® and with over 77,000 stores globally (more than any other retailer or food service provider), we sell over 14 million a month.


But there’s a lot more to our story and much more left to be written. We are transforming our business, ensuring we are customer obsessed and digitally enabled to seamlessly link our brick and mortar stores with digital products and services.




At 7-Eleven the entrepreneurial spirit is in our DNA and has been ever since our inception 90+ years ago. It’s what drove us to invent the convenience industry in 1927 by envisioning how a simple ice dock could provide household staples such as milk and eggs to better serve the needs of our customers.




Today we are redefining convenience and the customer experience in big ways...we are fundamentally changing our culture and we want talented, innovative, customer obsessed, and entrepreneurial people like you to come make history with us.


How we lead

At 7-Eleven we are guided by our Leadership Principles.




Be Customer Obsessed
Be Courageous with Your Point of View
Challenge the Status Quo
Act Like an Entrepreneur
Have an “It Can Be Done” Attitude
Do the Right Thing
Be Accountable

Each principle has a defined set of behaviors which help guide the 7-Eleven team to Serve Customers and Support Stores.


About This Opportunity

Manage the delivery P&L to ensure we drive profitability and operate within budget constraints.
Design frameworks for the team to develop A|B testing framework.
Synthesize data and analysis (e.g., A/B testing) to generate actionable insights to solve complex problems.
Conduct deep dive analysis to identify profitability optimization opportunities, apply problem solving methodology to drive sustainable improvements.
Apply existing and new solutions in creative ways to address complex issues and problems.
Build out advanced analytical capabilities and define analytical priorities.
Ability to independently analyze data, generate relevant insights, present to diverse audience, and convey sophisticated findings in a clear and impactful way. Ability to develop frameworks and train the teams do the same.
People Management: Coaching and mentoring analysts with a goal of developing and retaining high performing talent.

Bachelors/4 Year Degree.

Overview:

With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo’s leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.


Your role will be part of a growing team focused on supporting the Enterprise Data Organization (EDO) Operations team within PepsiCo. You will directly support the EDO Operations Lead with managing the EDO resourcing/staffing plans, budget considerations, and Annual Operating Plans. You will work closely and collaborate with the Enterprise Data Organization team to ensure monthly actuals and forecast resources and cost are maintained and implement new processes to streamline how the team operates. You will be one of the central point of connection for the Enterprise Data Organization Chapter to ensure the day to day resource and financial management of the team is executed seamlessly.

Responsibilities:

Resource Management:

Coordinate across Enterprise Data Organization overall resourcing needs on a continual basis.
Identify areas of opportunity to streamline and optimize resourcing across Enterprise Data Organization teams
Complete all period resourcing updates in central resource management tool, OneRoster and internal EDO Trackers
Conduct analysis of complex resourcing data sets and develop thoughtful insights that will help drive business decisions
Leverage tools such as PowerBI and Excel to assist the team with visualizing current and future resourcing plans
Steward and manage all open role budget forecasts and mapping for the team
Serve as the point of contact for all day to day resourcing needs within the Enterprise Data Organization team.
Support the Enterprise Data Organization team through resource planning as part of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) process
Lead and coordinat all SOW /WO, PO, and invoice management processes in accordance with approved budget
Ability to work and understand finance and global procurement processes to efficiently process SOWs /WO’s, POs, Invoices, etc.

Budget Management:

Track, maintain, and coordinate the Enterprise Data Organization team financials along side our finance business partners
Conduct thorough analysis of the Enterprise Data Organization financials, identify, and flag any gaps or issues identified
Steward the financial management of the Enterprise Data Organization team across various program operational budgets and CapEx budgets
Track and manage all Enterprise Data Organization contractors and ensure all updates are captured in the central resource management tool, OneRoster and internal EDO Trackers
Support monthly financial reviews with Finance and Enterprise Data Organization leadership team
Serve as the contact for Enterprise Data Organization with Finance Business Partners


Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university required, MBA preferred
5-7 years of experience in either business operations, FP&A, or related operations role
Experience navigating large matrix organizations
Extensive experience in visualization tools such as PowerBI
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong system and technical skills not limited to: PowerBI, Microsoft Excel, Microsof PowerPoint, & Sharepoint
Advance experience in MS Office Product (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Sharepoint, etc.)
Self-starter mindset with the capability to “manage-up”
Global outlook with sensitivity and awareness of social and cultural differences
Positive, self-starter mindset with the capability to “manage-up”
Ability to solve complex problems and solutions with simplicity and scale
Ability to navigate matrix organizational environment
Excellent collaborator
Ability to manage and complete multiple tasks within tight deadlines
