Job Title: Solution Owner (Irving, TX or Tampa, FL)
Job Description:
SEIZE THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE A PART OF SOMETHING GREAT!

Presidio is on the leading edge of a technology-driven movement to transform the way business is done, for our customers and our customers' customers. Joining Presidio means immersing yourself in a culture of self-starters, collaborators and innovators who make real, lasting change in the marketplace via cutting-edge technology and business solutions. At Presidio, we know that it’s our people that make the connections happen.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US? You will set your career on track for outstanding achievement with a company that knows no limits. Presidio is a leading a global digital services and solutions provider focused on Digital Infrastructure, Business Analytics, Cloud, Security & Emerging solutions.

THE ROLE: Solution Owner

Presidio is looking for a seasoned Solution Owner with experience working directly with customers and stakeholders to understand, document and manage requirements relating to technical development projects. Presidio Solution Owners work directly with the project team, clients, and partners to lead the requirements gathering and management process plus ensure the client requests are translated into technical requirements the development team can deliver against. This is a customer-centered and product-centered role, ultimately owning the results of the product delivery.

Job Summary:

As a Solution Owner, you will play a key leadership role within a product delivery team, as the main contact to the customer to understand their business needs and goals for the product. You will collaborate with the customer and work closely with the delivery team to ensure the delivered product meets the desired customer outcome.

Travel Requirements:

In this role you will be expected to travel up to 25%. This role will be a remote work situation.

Job Responsibilities:

Conduct interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods as appropriate given customer and project factors
Take information gathered from interviews and other methods and translate into technical requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team, creating Epics and Stories
Manage requirements and associated expectations of project stakeholders (to include internal, partner and customer sponsors and stakeholders)
Identify and establish scope and parameters for a project based on requirements analysis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics
Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements
Lead and provide guidance to the entire project team as needed regarding the developed application to ensure features and functions are enabled to meet customer requirements
Lead and guide team to execute on shared vision, outlining a plan for achieving success
Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the requirements to ensure that documented requirements are correctly interpreted, with team and business stakeholders
Assist with the interpretation of customer requirements into feasible options, and communicate these back to the business stakeholders
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements — verbally or through written documentation — to project managers, customers, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood. When needed, solicit approval by the customer or stakeholder on affected requirements
Partners with stakeholders and customers across the organization to carry forward and communicate the product vision, strategy, features, and prioritization
Develops, owns, and executes product roadmap
Translates product roadmap features into well-defined product requirements including epics, user stories, features, and acceptance criteria
Prioritize and maintain the Sprint backlog for assigned products, balancing the requirements of customers and stakeholders
Lead the planning of product release plans and set the expectation for delivery of new functionality
Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of Release/Sprint Goals
Perform research to understand the latest changes in the market and the business and determine potential impact on current strategy and requirements, sharing any pertinent findings with the customer
Quickly assimilate into the client team, project team and culture, becoming a valuable contributor

Required Skills:

Excellent client-facing communication skills both written and oral, along with strong listening, interpersonal and relationship-building skills
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development
Demonstrable skills across project development methodologies (Agile, SCRUM, Kanban, Waterfall)
Proficient in Confluence, Jira or other similar tools
Experience with Cloud / Azure / Microsoft O365 suite of tools
Outstanding overall communication, presentation, and leadership skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire partners and stakeholders to drive collaboration and alignment
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Sharp analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Creative thinker with a vision

Additional Desired Skills:

Strong thought leadership, team building, motivational and customer service skills
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Highly self-motivated and directed, a self-starter
Put people before technology. Ask great questions. Always think ahead. Turn data into useful information. Passion to deliver results and exceed expectations
Ability to learn quickly, adapt to change and have ownership of learning new tools as applicable to help in the requirements gathering, refinement and management process
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Works as a team player, willing to perform other tasks as needed to help the team, even if not part of their defined role and responsibilities
Passion, creativity, energy, and enthusiasm towards collaborating on the exciting growth and development of our customers and our company
A desire to learn new technologies, methodologies, solutions and understand the business objectives and needs of our customers
Adaptability to our overall vision, goals and dynamic culture and environment.
Elicit, analyze, specify, document, and validate the business needs and requirements of stakeholders, be they customers or end users

Education and Experience:

BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar relevant field
A minimum of 5-8 years of experience in a Solution Owner or Product Owner role, technology Project Manager, Program Manager, Senior Business Analyst or related work experience

Job Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst/Product Owner - Workday Integrations
Job Description:
Senior Business Systems Analyst/Product Owner - Workday Integrations

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 240+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

At Equinix, we help the world’s digital leaders scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences, and transform people’s lives. Our culture is based on collaboration and the growth and development of our teams.

We hire hardworking people who thrive on solving challenging problems and give them opportunities to hone new skills, and try new approaches, as we grow our product portfolio with new software and network architecture solutions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary
Analyzes business requirements/functional designs to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. Designs software systems.


Responsibilities




Work closely with Human Resources and other Equinix stakeholders to understand business requirements related to integration requests and execute them through successful implementation and testing
Design and develop integration between Workday, Payroll, Benefits provides and various HR Boundary systems
Participate in projects and ensure coverage of all facets of design, development, testing, and a successful end-user experience
Build productive relationships with the IT Global team, including BSAs, developers, and infrastructure
Build productive relationships with the HR Global organization
Build and manage productive relationships with the various systems vendors and customer representatives
Analyze and determine application and interface solutions, understand application functionality
Perform system set-up, configuration, testing, and support day-to-day systems and interfaces issues
Provide production support for Workday by debugging and fixing integrations
Stay current with industry and Equinix best practices and promotes opportunities for improvement through automation
Utilize IT Software Development Life Cycle methodology and Agile as they fit the initiative
Support internal and external systems audit initiatives
Manages enhancement and project releases for Workday
Triages and troubleshoots issues
Provides status against plans and escalates issues
Training and Change Management
May conduct research, pilot features and document and prepare recommendations for review
Documents configurations for future use and training Day to Day Support (Production Support)


Qualifications

Minimum of 4 years of Workday technical experience developing integrations using Workday Studio, Core Connectors, XSLT and EIBs
Minimum of 2 years of Workday functional experience in configuring and debugging business processes, validation rules, calc fields, report writing and system security
Minimum of 1 years of Project lead experience
7+ years of work experience
Excellent knowledge of HR, Payroll systems and ability to take the lead as the business systems analyst on HR Systems including Workday and ADP
Acute understanding of business systems analysis and how to apply it to complex solutions
Good understanding of HR, Payroll and related Finance business processes, systems and their inter-dependencies
Bachelors Degree in Information Systems or related area
Ability to balance business requirements, compliance regulations, and technology capabilities for global projects
Ability to provide leadership on projects to other Business Analysts
Outstanding communication skills
Ability to skillfully influence without authority
Ability to build and work with cross-functional teams across the organization
Ability to effectively manage confidentiality of information
Ability to quickly learn new systems, processes, and technology
Preferably Workday HCM and Integration certified
Preferably knowledge of middleware platforms - Tibco or Boomi or Snaplogic
Preferably knowledge of Anaplan

Role: Business Analyst (Wealth Management)

Location: Irving, Dallas or New York

Experience : 8 to 12 yrs

Domain: Wealth Management, Capital Markets, Private Banking

Key Responsibilities:

Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders, including wealth advisors, financial planners, and IT teams, to understand and document business requirements related to wealth management solutions.
Data Analysis: Conduct data analysis to identify trends and patterns in client portfolios, investment strategies, and market dynamics to support informed decision-making.
Process Improvement: Assess current processes and workflows within the wealth banking division and recommend improvements to streamline operations, reduce risks, and enhance client experiences.
System Integration: Work with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of wealth management systems and applications, facilitating efficient data flow and automation.
Performance Metrics: Define, track, and report key performance indicators (KPIs) for wealth banking products and services to measure their success and identify areas for improvement.
Client Insights: Analyze client behavior and preferences to develop strategies for better client engagement, tailored financial solutions, and personalized services.
Regulatory Compliance: Stay current with financial regulations and ensure that wealth banking operations and systems are compliant with all relevant laws and regulations.
Market Research: Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and market developments to provide insights and recommendations for adapting to changing market conditions.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of processes, procedures, and project requirements for reference and auditing purposes.
Collaboration: Foster effective communication and collaboration with internal teams, external partners, and stakeholders to ensure project success and alignment with business goals.

Careington International Corporation is a solutions-oriented company. An established leader, we have been a trailblazer in the field of discount health care since 1979. Over the years, our mission has remained the same — to create discount health programs that are marketable to the employer, profitable to the provider and economical for the member. In response to a growing demand for our products and services in recent years, our growth means that we continuously strive to recruit innovators to join our fast-paced, forward-thinking team.

We are based in Frisco, TX and employ prospective candidates that are able to work a Hybrid work arrangement, three days in the office and two days remotely. If you are looking for a great company culture filled with rewarding career advancement opportunities, this is the place for you.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Technical Operations Leader will oversee functions or processes necessary for the administration of the company’s wholesale and individual retail business. Develops strategies meant to assist the business in meeting its critical goals and objectives in the most efficient manner possible. Evaluates and recommends changes to policies or procedures. Acts as a technical consultant. Ensures the technology and architectural roadmap is properly aligned with and supports the product/business road map.

QUALIFICATIONS:

10 years of Operations experience required.
8 years of Technical Business Analyst or Project Management is preferred.
Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Suite, to include Excel, PowerPoint, & Word

SKILLS:

Collaborative professional with a drive for results, decisiveness, and passion for winning; coupled with compassion and a ‘thoughtfully assertive’ approach
Unquestioned integrity
Proven ability to both design and implement department initiatives
Analytically oriented and demonstrated success in making timely, effective, principles-based decisions
Highly effective verbal communication skills including courtesy, resourcefulness, and efficiency in answering questions, providing internal / external direction, and explaining corporate / departmental policies and procedures are necessary
A high level of enthusiasm for building successful teams and a personal sense of urgency and capacity to overcome obstacles is a must
Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills demonstrating proactive approaches to problem-solving with strong decision-making capability
Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities/projects and proven ability to develop internal and external relationships.
Ability and experience interacting with high-level clients, both internally and externally
Strong team player and corporate focused doer with a “roll-up-the-sleeves” attitude
Self-motivated
Service and people oriented
Comfortable with, and able to operate by influence rather than control
Creative, resourceful, accessible, responsive
Positive attitude with a sense of urgency and passion for the work

EXPECTED WORK AND PERFORMANCE:

Accountable for the improvement and the operational systems, processes, and policies in support of organizations mission
Accountable for all aspects of billing and commissions to ensure accuracy and timeliness in all areas of responsibility including handling of all monies
Examine the cost of operations and create plans for reducing costs without sacrificing quality and execution
Review the regular cadence of auditing reports to determine areas where quality standards can improve
Provide ongoing training and coaching to ensure thorough knowledge of system, processes, and procedures
Escalation for issues not resolved by front line management
Accountable for internal and external Operations reporting including QA and profitability reports
Review and approve monthly commissions for accuracy; both Internal & External commissions
Help facilitate and establish departmental goals regarding production and process efficiencies
Supervise and coach Operations front line management team, Agent Administration team
Accountable for the completion of Operational areas of SSAE/SOC audits

EDUCATION:

A Bachelor’s degree in business administration or a related discipline is required for the position.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

The selected candidate will work at our corporate headquarters in Frisco, TX. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Education
Required
Bachelors or better in Business Administration or related field

Job Summary

As a part of the Global Legal Operations team, the Senior Legal Operations Analyst will be responsible for working with various stakeholders at all levels across the Legal department on projects, from opportunity alignment and requirements gathering through design and delivery. The focus for this role will be on technology projects that drive digital transformation across the Legal practice areas, from enhancing current systems, supporting system integrations to developing business requirements and common processes for new system deployments. The Senior Legal Operations Analyst will need to juggle responsibilities with a wide range of complexities, while also remaining methodical and organized.




We are seeking a bright, enthusiastic, business minded, and results-oriented professional with solid legal technology experience and the ability to coordinate with cross-functional teams. To excel in this role, you will be a proactive representative of the Global Legal Operations team, eager to make a lasting impact with a passion for innovation. Successful candidates will have experience deploying a wide range of digital technology to a legal practice area or a complimentary function with transferable skills.




Responsibilities

Project management of Legal technology initiatives, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within scope and within budget.

Independently conduct internal/external research to completion of basic and complex requests

Understand and uncover business needs and objectives for the Legal department, including understanding existing processes, gaps, goals, and improvement opportunities

Define project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility

Lead the implementation, deployment, and further development of Legal Technology systems

Create, gather, document, and analyze business requirements and partner with IT, cross functional stakeholders and external service providers to recommend practical, innovative solutions

Lead, coordinate, and conduct user acceptance testing

Lead the development of customized training materials

Act as the liaison with various stakeholders, including IT

Lead cross functional process management discussions

Translate business challenges into systems (single or cross functional) requirements design

Gather metrics and generate routine reports that measure adoption of processes and tools

Partner with Data & Analytics teams to develop meaningful usage reports or communicate the need for raw data to develop customized reports

Provide trainings as required on various functions, processes or technologies

Provide recommendations on promoting awareness and increase user adoption of tools

Use a variety of problem-solving skills to resolve issues with internal teams and stakeholders

Qualifications

Proven years completing similar tasks to those above, and within a Legal or IT environment, preferred

Bachelor's degree required

Experience with Legal technology and processes required

Agile Project Management qualifications preferred

Ability to identify and manage cross-team and cross-project dependencies

Ability to communicate clearly and efficiently, both verbally and written

Ability to anticipate and address issues early with strong customer focus

Strong analytical skills including business case acumen

Ability to balance and prioritize multiple projects for various internal customers

Strong interpersonal and communication skills required

Ability to make decisions independently, knowing how and when to escalate issues

Experience working directly with business teams and stakeholders

Experience in Legal domains preferred, including but not limited to Corporate Legal, Compliance, Privacy, and Entity Management

Knowledge of Project Management Technology, such as SharePoint, Jira, Smartsheet, Tableau, Box

Experience with Legal technologies, such as ServiceNow, Onit, iManage, OneTrust, and Diligent

The Senior Analyst, Business Systems is a key position within the Finance organization, responsible for assessing and managing enterprise projects and business initiatives that impact T-Mobile’s accounting and financial reporting processes. This role reports to the Sr Manager, Business Systems Analysis as an individual contributor. This individual will be responsible for representing Finance on enterprise projects through the project lifecycle, including assessments, business requirements, operational impacts and solution, system design, testing and launch approvals. This position partners closely with product owners and other teams across the enterprise and has significant interaction with finance leadership.

The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in both business analysis and technical and/or operational accounting. To effectively support projects, the candidate will become a SME (Subject Matter Expert) in one or multiple areas of accounting, developing an understanding of transactional flows, financial risks, controls and corresponding journal entries through the various systems to drive scalable solutions and operational accounting efficiencies. Responsibilities

Manage projects from concept approval to launch including status reporting and go/no go recommendations to accounting leadership.
Partner effectively with cross-functional teams to support business initiatives, drive process improvements, and implement best practices.
Elicit requirements and write user stories with acceptance criteria.
Communicate and advocate for business requirements to project teams, ensuring the solution design meets the requirements.
Collaborate effectively and communicate with all levels of management and cross-functional teams.
Manage risks and issues, develop mitigation plans, and escalate as appropriate.
Serve as a knowledgeable resource and SME to business partners and cross-functional enterprise project teams.
Develop/review test plans, communicate with testing teams, and review test results, and perform traceability to ensure all requirements are tested.

CPA or Chartered Accountant preferred.

Job Title: Analyst II, Business (226 Days) BOND FUNDED
Job Description:
Analyst II, Business (226 Days) BOND FUNDED -(RTP20231002-021)
Description
Prepare high-impact charts, data visualization, PowerPoint presentations and other types of quality reports and presentations suitable to communicate results to a variety of audiences.
Must be able to analyze complex processes, identify areas for improvement and recommend solutions.
Provides knowledge in the following ServiceNow areas: solutions scoping, requirements analysis, gap analysis, feasibility, functional design, application configuration, integration testing, user acceptance testing, production deployment, change management, support and training.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, tasks and workflow analysis.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements, Business Requirements Document, and Use Cases.
Investigates reported application problems and works with system administartor to test, diagnose and isolate the root cause of problems. Prepares incident reports for further investigation by technical operations and development experts.
Keep abreast of technical, legislative, and professional trends and developments affecting the department's operations and programs and disseminate this information to appropriate personnel.
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
Work independently with users to define concepts and under the direction of project manager.
Maintains confidentiality of sensitive data request.
Performs all other tasks and duties as assigned.

All federally funded incumbents of this position must comply with time and effort reporting requirements through personnel activity reports or periodic certification, as appropriate.



Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science or related field.
5 or more years of specific job experience related to business analysis in complex environments with a Customer Relationship. Management, IT Operations focus. Analytical and research experience required.
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.

Demonstrated ability to review and make presentations regarding program operations, operating reports and department procedures.

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.
Skills and attributes for success:
Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders.
Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes.
Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships

Qualifications:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users.
Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently.
Must possess exceptional attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills

Ideally, you will also have:
Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)

Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Knowledge of data governance best practices and principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Team player with the ability to work independently.
Strong interpersonal skills and a keen ability to build and nurture relationships.
Organized, detail-oriented, and able to juggle multiple priorities simultaneously.

Job Title: SAP Sales and Distribution Functional Analyst
Job Description:
it’s what’s inside that counts

_______________________________


There’s more to CMC than our steel products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. At CMC, it’s the people inside our recycling centers, fabrication plants, steel mills and offices that make us who we are as a company. Our success comes from finding, retaining, and supporting the highest quality talent by offering:

Day 1 benefits coverage with low cost medical, vision, dental
Paid-time off and vacation starting Day 1
Competitive compensation and bonuses
Company-paid Lifestyle fund, life and disability insurance
Company matching 401(k) plan
Employee stock purchase plan
Training and advancement opportunities
Why This Job

CMC provides an excellent opportunity to learn the steel industry and grow in your career. Whether you will spend your day in an office cubicle, operating a crane or running the melt shop at one of our mills, at CMC, you’ll get the training and support from your team that you need to excel in your role and reach your full potential.


Responsible for defi ning, designing, governing, delivering, and supporting SAP centric solutions that enable and enhance the CMCOrder to Cash Process. Build and maintain eff ective relationships with key business stakeholders by off ering guidance andrecommendations as needed to ensure clarity of understanding and alignment of company goals. Partner with various IT teammembers to ensure feasibility, comprehension, and successful delivery of business requirement best practice solutions. Eff ectivelycommunicate and properly manage time providing on-going SAP Sales and Logistics support, including development of business cases,business requirement and process documentation, test scenarios, and training materials. Actively multitask and collaborate within ahigh performing team that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, and promotes continuous learning.

What You'll Do
Analyze and design new business processes for Sales and Logistics business units for a multi-faceted manufacturing industry
Apply technical and functional knowledge to create world-class solution architecture that effectively integrates with the business units’ operations
Build and maintain effective relationships with key business and IT stakeholders
Understand current and future business requirements and strategies for information technology services and systems
Document business needs, distinguish between needs and wants, identify gaps between business needs and standard application functionality
Design and document solutions that fill the gaps, and provide detailed business requirements specifications for developers
Develop, document, and execute test plans to assess the integrity and accuracy of business processes, functional modifications/enhancements, etc
Maintain business process and end user training documentation and deliver training as required
Support, analyze, and resolve production application issues as required
What You'll Need
Five or more years of work experience within the SAP ECC standard Sales, Distribution, and Logistics space
Five or more years of experience as an SAP business or functional analyst
Advanced time management and analytical skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Motivated self-starter that can work effectively with minimal supervision
Ability to multitask and collaborate in a functional, technical, multidiscipline, high performing team to plan and meet aggressive deadlines
Experience with and knowledgeable of Transportation and Fleet Management
Experience with TMW, SQL, and Microsoft Applications preferred
Experience delivering projects in an agile environment preferred
Experience in the industrial manufacturing and/or process industry preferred
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills, with an ability to use appropriate analysis and logic when solving problems
Ability to maintain awareness and knowledge of relevant, existing and emerging technologies and the impact they have on CMC business operations
Results oriented with focus on achieving both short and long term goals in fluid environment
Your Education
A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, or related discipline with an IT focus is preferred
An advanced degree is preferred

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. Our steel products have been supporting structures in more than 20 countries for over 100 years. And the secret to our success? We’ve built our legacy by assembling a team of innovators and doers to tackle some of the most challenging problems facing our world over the last 100 years — but we’re just getting started.


If you’re ready to reimagine ways to make the steel industry more sustainable, reinforce the bridges and roadways connecting our communities, and do meaningful work, you’re ready to join CMC. Apply today and start moving your career — and our world — forward.


CMC is committed to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, citizenship, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, or other status protected by federal, state or local law.

Job Description


It’s all about the customer.

As a Lead Program Analyst, you will lead and manage client deliverables relative to our loyalty engagements. This role requires you to have both business and technical expertise where we will need you to act as a primary liaison between the client and the technical delivery teams. You will play a key role in projects: requirements elicitation, documentation, configuration, and testing. In addition, you will be expected to work closely with the Project Manager (or Account Manager) to assist in project delivery.

What you’ll do as a Lead Program Analyst

Interpret and articulate a client's vision, objectives and connect them to targeted customer journeys/use cases
Lead client discussions and quickly develop rapport and establish credibility that results in trust and respect from client, business, and technical teams
Facilitate effective project requirement/solution meetings while exhibiting confidence.
Help implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way and build key relationships with stakeholders/partners.
Review Offer/Moment related briefs, connect with stakeholders for clarifications and configure in the Loyalty platform. Understand business needs, program goals, and underlying solution to balance incoming requests/suggestions with capabilities and budget.
Lead the BSA team on data quality analysis and recommend changes when required
Lead and review detailed analysis of product feature fitment versus business requirements to create functional specifications for gap areas
Perform QC, smoke-testing, unit-testing, and validate the offers and moments in QA, UAT and Product regions ensuring error free configuration.
Lead client discussion on Offer requirements and configurations, review and provide walkthrough to project team on configurations. This includes ensuring all required offer attributes and performance insights are understood and implemented.
Lead review of BSA artifacts and other deliverables like requirements documents, source to targets, and API specifications
Lead effective client meetings, understand deliverables, and drive successful outcomes
Lead efforts towards building knowledge repository - Document functional documents, application existing capabilities, process documents, business rules documents for the Loyalty program, Program configuration and integration.
Document system context, requirements, use cases, user story ensuring coverage for all existing applications and solutions
Provide expertise and knowledge in Loyalty and Rewards management procedures and best practices

What skills you will use:

8+ years of relevant business analysis work experience in the database/data-driven loyalty space
Extensive knowledge and experience in Loyalty & Rewards Management
Solid understanding of marketing concepts
Experience in delivering projects and solutions with using Agile/Scrum methodologies is a plus
Ability to lead and execute the documentation of business requirements, functional specifications, and other client deliverables
Expertise in understanding and analyzing data from different sources
Excellent understanding of data warehouse and data mart concepts
Expert SQL skills
Excellent understanding of API, JSON ,XML and SOAP UI
MS Office including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and quickly change priorities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively with global teams.
Ability to lead a team of BSAs and mentor them through projects and support their career growth
Ability to effectively navigate and lead a cross functional organization to get work done
Excellent drive and initiative, and sense of personal accountability
Excellent knowledge of Financial Services domain and PCI Compliance


Additional Information


About Epsilon

Epsilon is a global advertising and marketing technology company positioned at the center of Publicis Groupe. Epsilon accelerates clients’ ability to harness the power of their first-party data to activate campaigns across channels and devices, with an unparalleled ability to prove outcomes. The company’s industry-leading technology connects advertisers with consumers to drive performance while respecting and protecting consumer privacy. Epsilon’s people-based identity graph allows brands, agencies and publishers to reach real people, not cookies or devices, across the open web. For more information, visit epsilon.com.

When you’re one of us, you get to run with the best. For decades, we’ve been helping marketers from the world’s top brands personalize experiences for millions of people with our cutting-edge technology, solutions and services. Epsilon’s best-in-class identity gives brands a clear, privacy-safe view of their customers, which they can use across our suite of digital media, messaging and loyalty solutions. We process 400+ billion consumer actions each day and hold many patents of proprietary technology, including real-time modeling languages and consumer privacy advancements. Thanks to the work of every employee, Epsilon has been consistently recognized as industry-leading by Forrester, Adweek and the MRC. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe, Epsilon is a global company with more than 8,000 employees around the world. Position title: Sr. SAP Vistex Business Analyst

Work location: Irving, TX (Hybrid role)

Current Need

We are looking to add a Sr. SAP Vistex Business Analyst to join our SAP AMS team. The position is hybrid, located in Las Colinas, Irving, TX.

Position Description

Responsible for leading a team of SAP Vistex technical & functional consultants and managing the outcomes in various SAP applications & processes.
Core member of SAP application maintenance services team responsible for delivery of new SAP service functionality
Partners with other team members to design and develop functionality that address business functional requirements.
Makes and tests configuration changes to SAP modules to reflect the functional design decisions that were made.
Responsible for value-stream identification and end-to-end traceability documentation
Validation & acceptance of MSP deliverables for complex Vistex processes (such as Contracts, Chargebacks, Rebates & Incentives) & Integrations with multiple IT teams. Provide guidance & ensure standards of delivery by the MSP for optimized and effective outcomes.

Must have skills and Responsibilities:

Multiple lifecycle Vistex implementations or 4+ years SAP Vistex experience
Solid understanding of the Vistex business processes such as Contracts, Chargebacks, Billbacks, Rebates, Incentives.
Solid understanding of the Vistex MDM such as Vendor Master, Customer Master, Material Master, etc and the syndication processes.
Experience working with MSP resources onsite and offshore - both development and quality assurance.
Expertise and demonstrated experience in test life cycle management which includes organizing and managing all phases of the test process, planning tests, executing tests, and defect management process.
Demonstrated experience in solutioning using multiple disparate platforms/applications (SAP & non-SAP) to meet needed outcomes and support of the same.
Understanding of core reporting applications/technologies like SAP BW and tools and the interfacing
Experience creating and executing unit test plans

Good to have skills

Experience in working with middleware technologies (MuleSoft, IBM Message Broker, WebSphere, etc.) for API & integrations
Demonstrated change leadership skills (i.e., ability to effectively manage communication, negotiate successful outcomes, identify risks, engage correct stakeholders, etc.).
Proven work history that includes multiple projects implemented through all phases of a development lifecycle.

Job Title: Sr. Business Accountability Specialist- Analytics, Reporting & Presentation
Job Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Business Accountability Specialist to join the HR Business Risk Management Team. The position will be responsible for standards and controls in the business, ensuring effective design, assessment, monitoring, and execution through establishment of protocols, assessment, risk mitigation, oversight, reporting, and self-assurance activities.

In this role, you will:
Be a key member of a growing and evolving team supporting Human Resources Risk Management.
Manage projects and drive initiatives through implementation.
Develop and organize standard documentation.
Coordinate and organize cross-team initiatives
Analyze reporting and data, including trending and themes
Develop executive presentations to tell the story of the data, forming clear calls-to-action
Lead or participate in moderately complex initiatives and deliverables within business and contribute to large-scale, cross-functional planning related to mitigation of current and emerging business risk issues and concerns
Assess, analyze, and design moderately complex controls, protocols, and approaches with respect to risk mitigation and the control environment, including ensuring effective planning for sustainability, ongoing control adherence, reporting, measurement, technology impacts, and monitoring
Independently make decisions and resolve moderately complex issues while leveraging solid understanding of the business's functional area or products, operations, and regulatory environment; facilitate decision-making and issue resolution, and support implementation of developed solutions and plans; lead peers and key business partners to meet deliverables and drive new initiatives
Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, and mid-level managers to address current and emerging risks associated with business activities and operations, and provide guidance or support in interpreting, developing, and implementing risk-mitigating strategies
Partner with peers and the business in interactions with external parties to support appropriateness and timeliness of response, and effectiveness of communications and materials
May serve as a mentor for lower-level staff
Required Qualifications:
4+ years of risk management, business controls, quality assurance, business operations, compliance, or process experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
Desired Qualifications:
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Project management experience
Experience identifying risk exposure and propose solutions as well as key issues, involve affected parties, design solutions, obtain buy-in and communicate effectively through resolution
Experience presenting information in a manner that persuades, educates, and enhances understanding at all levels
Ability to create and manage capacity planning and gearing ratio tools
Experience with Power Bi and Tableau creating dashboards
Enhanced Microsoft Excel skills, including pivot tables, macros, charts, and VLOOKUPs.
Advanced PowerPoint design skills, including development of Executive decks, with the ability to tell complex stories succinctly and visually.
Job Expectations:
This position will require onsite presence at one of the locations listed below in a hybrid work schedule
Ability to travel up to 10%
Relocation assistance is not available for this position
This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

7001 Westown Parkway West Des Moines, Iowa
4101 Wiseman Blvd. San Antonio, Texas
1301 Solana Blvd, Westlake. Texas

Job Title: SOC Insider Threat Hunter, Operations Analyst (C12)
Job Description:
About Citi:

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.


As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients’ best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Enterprise Operations & Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do from keeping the bank safe, managing global resources, and providing the technical tools our workers need to be successful to designing our digital architecture and ensuring our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. We reimagine client and partner experiences to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and efficient services.


Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. We value and demand respect for others, promote individuals based on merit, and ensure opportunities for personal development are widely available to all. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We’ll enable growth and progress together.

The Team:

The Insider Threat Hunting Ops (ITHO) team sits in the SOC actively monitoring Citi's network against malicious attempts to harm the organization utilizing cybersecurity tools and trend analysis.

The Role:

The SOC Insider Threat Hunting Analyst is an intermediate level position responsible for leading efforts to prevent, monitor and respond to information/data breaches and cyber-attacks. The overall objective of this role is to ensure the execution of Information Security directives and activities in alignment with Citi's data security policy.

Responsibilities:

Monitor and analyze logs and alerts on a variety of different technologies across multiple platforms to identify security incidents
Proactively hunt for insider threat utilizing large datasets, tools, and detections
Continually assess and refine insider threat detections
Execute analysis of email-based threats to include understanding of email communications, platforms, headers, transactions, and identification of malicious tactics, techniques, and procedures
Utilize a variety of security tools and technologies to analyze potential threats to determine impact, scope, and recovery
Utilize strong analytical and problem-solving skills to detect and respond to insider threats effectively
Leverage network security tools and capabilities to support Cyber Threat Monitoring activities
Assist Security Incident Response Teams with incident investigations and aid in technical risk assessments
Identify and develop new and improved technical procedures and process control manuals
Identify significant IS threats and vulnerabilities
Perform regular assessments based on changes in the threat landscape as needed
Appropriately assess and prioritize risk
Maintain a strong code of ethics and respecting privacy while investigating insider Threat related incidents is essential

Qualifications:

3+ years' hands-on relevant experience working in a SOC/application security role or equivalent experience
Cybersecurity experience is an absolute requirement
Strong experience working with DLP tools, UEBA, and SIEM technologies
Strong proficiency with threat analysis tools
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
Strong working knowledge of Threat Monitoring Procedures
Knowledge and exposure in creating use cases
Direct experience working with large datasets
Hands-on experience in threat hunting in a corporate environment
Proven analytical skills
Knowledge and exposure to SOAR technology highly preferred
Scripting/coding experience is a big plus
Previous experience as an insider threat analyst and/or threat hunter preferred

Education:

Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience required
Certifications: CISA, CISSP, ITPM (Insider Threat Program Manager), SANs

This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

-

Job Family Group:

Technology

-

Job Family:

Information Security

-

Time Type:

Full time

Irving Texas United States

Job Title: Business Analytics Lead Analyst (Actuarial Data Strategy & Solutions - Repricing)
Job Description:
Summary

We are seeking a self-motivated and inquisitive business analytics professional with a strong desire to learn to join our team. This individual should be a team player who enjoys working in a dynamic environment.

As part of Actuarial Data Strategy & Solutions, the Repricing team supports Cigna's pre-sale and re-sale process and is responsible for medical claim repricing analysis and RFP responses typically related to network financial information such as network discounts, medical utilization statistics and medical trend.

This role will support the development and analysis of Cigna's repricing data, tools and methodology. This position will also develop and maintain internal analysis and reporting to assist management in data review and will also participate in projects and ad-hoc analysis as needed.

Responsibilities

Respond to Medical claim re-pricings and RFP requests

Verify appropriateness of results and ensure accuracy of data analysis and reporting by creating appropriate data checks and internal review documents and tools

Conduct audits to ensure financial controls are maintained

Create, modify, and maintain SAS/SQL coding to accommodate data requests and changes

Create, modify, and maintain databases and reporting tools (Excel and Access). Recommend improvements in financial reporting systems as appropriate

Develop new tools and reports and review existing tools and reports to account for evolving business needs, including implementing process changes to optimize efficiency and results using automation where appropriate

Perform research and analysis of key drivers and changes and communicate results to project lead and management

Conduct or participate in moderate to complex financial analysis projects and/or reporting

Conduct ad hoc analysis in response to internal/external questions and assist with case level analysis and requests as needed

Develop a thorough knowledge of systems, processes and methodologies and communicate those to technical and non-technical audiences

Develop and maintain documentation on all processes and tools

Assist in the education of sales and underwriting on the claim repricing process and interpretation of results

Assist in the education and training of new team members

Cultivate and maintain working relationships with all internal and external partners

Function independently with general supervision in a fast-paced environment

Utilize independent judgment and discretion to identify variances and key issues

Qualifications

2+ years' of experience in healthcare analytics with a general knowledge of healthcare insurance industry, terminology and/or systems

Experience querying and manipulating large sets of data using Intermediate to Advanced level Microsoft Excel and Access

SQL/SAS coding skills preferred (but not required)

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Able to think critically and improve processes to optimize results

Proven ability to apply quality checks to ensure data integrity

Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes and procedures

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Able to independently prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities while meeting deadlines




If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of 72,800 - 121,400 USD / yearly, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

We want you to be healthy, balanced, and feel secure. That’s why you’ll enjoy a comprehensive range of benefits, with a focus on supporting your whole health. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year and paid holidays. For more details on our employee benefits programs, visit Life at Cigna Group.

About The Cigna Group

Doing something meaningful starts with a simple decision, a commitment to changing lives. At The Cigna Group, we’re dedicated to improving the health and vitality of those we serve. Through our divisions Cigna Healthcare and Evernorth Health Services, we are committed to enhancing the lives of our clients, customers and patients. Join us in driving growth and improving lives.

Job Title: Sr. Manager, Shared Services Process Improvement (PTX2023-6088)

As the Sr. Manager, Shared Services Process Improvement, you will be responsible for organizing and managing all projects and improvement initiatives across Shared Services which includes but not limited to Accounting, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Collections, Tax, Audit, and Community Banking (Treasury).

The Sr. Manager, Shared Services Process Improvements primary focus will be on identifying and managing the timely delivery/implementation of new processes with the goal of streamlining them in order to provide better overall service efficiently. Responsibilities include:

Provide accounting and project management assistance to various areas and processes across all areas of Shared Services. Accounting, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Collections, Tax, Audit, and Community Banking (Treasury).
Drive for efficiency and automation
Coordinate with Shared Services leadership and teams to improve quality of services provided and enhance/create performance metrics.
Analyze business disputes, research root cause and implement processes and procedures to correct errors in intercompany activity. Coordinate with both the back office and front office to ensure all changes are made as necessary.

CiraConnect provides world-class cloud-based software and on-demand “back-office” shared services (SaaS) for self-managed community associations, professional community association management companies and residential real estate developers servicing the needs of homeowner associations (HOAs), condominium associations, cooperatives, luxury high-rises, municipal utility districts and large master planned communities. You will have the opportunity to perform in a technology-driven environment using our internally developed world-class accounting and financial reporting software. Our large and growing Shared Services team provides opportunities for career advancement into accounting team management and other advanced positions.

As a Service Manager at Billingsley you will play a key role in ensuring the smooth operation of our communities by taking on a variety of responsibilities. Your main focus will be on overseeing service budgets, monitoring and allocating funds, and managing service contracts. Your contributions will directly impact the overall quality of life for our residents.


Key Responsibilities:

Budget Management: Assist in the development of service budgets and financial resources necessary for maintenance and repair projects. Analyze market trends, financial reports, employee staffing levels, and organizational growth to work within approved budget guidelines.

Financial Oversight: Collaborate with the Portfolio Manager to monitor and allocate Turnover, Capex Funds, and R&M Budgets.

Contract Management: Develop, negotiate, and execute service contracts with the assistance of Corporate Purchasing. Manage and negotiate vendor contracts and contractor schedules while ensuring work is completed to our high standards.

Expense Control: Ensure that current and future maintenance and repair projects stay within approved budgeted expenses.

Safety Focus: Provide oversight of safety awareness and safety reports. Conduct inspections to ensure safety compliance and the high quality of our communities.

ROI Projects: Work with Portfolio Managers and Maintenance Directors to identify revenue-enhancing and expense-saving potential ROI Projects.

Preventive Maintenance: Review preventive maintenance programs and related work to ensure they are completed as required.

Team Development: Hire and train new staff, develop existing staff to maximize their potential, and create broad-level development plans for Service Managers.

Performance Management: Supervise direct reporting staff in accordance with company policy. Monitor staff performance, conduct performance reviews, and address performance problems through corrective action and dismissal when necessary.

Staff Scheduling: Manage schedules for maintenance personnel to ensure proper coverage of the portfolio and timely resolution of work orders.

Emergency Procedures: Develop and maintain emergency action procedures for the properties to ensure the safety of our residents.

Compliance: Comply with all company policies and procedures related to employment.

Core Values: Commit to living the Billinsgley Core Values each day in every action taken when executing the essential functions of the job.

PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS

Knowledge of organizational and community policies and procedures.
Knowledge and understanding of business concepts and research principles, processes, and techniques.
Knowledge of the principles of strategic business decision-making.
Ability to apply policies and procedures to solve Company issues.
Demonstrated understanding of overall property service management.
Demonstrate the ability to proactively prioritize needs and effectively manage resources.
Demonstrated experience and expertise in project planning and management; in analysis of operations for the purpose of proposing innovative solutions to problems; and in organizing, writing, and editing information.
Must know and follow the Fair Housing laws.
Strong personnel management skills.
Knowledge of fiscal management.
Demonstrated ability to monitor training programs and identify and provide one-on-one training as needed.
Ensures that minimum training requirements are met for all service teams in the area.
Mentors and coaches other Service Managers.
Ability to develop and prepare business analysis and plans.
Ability to exercise initiative, problem solving and decision-making skills.
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret financial reports and contracts.
Manage multiple projects, set priorities, exercise sound judgment, and clearly communicates findings and advice.
Ability to motivate, develop, and direct people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.
Ability to apply and teach the principles and practices of work leadership and management.
Motivate the community team and manage their performance in accordance with company policies, values, and business practices.
Proven exceptional communication skills both written and verbal.
Performs duties that require considerable initiative, independent judgment, and strong communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with residents, vendors, contractors, Company managers, and associates.
Respond to common or technical inquiries or complaints from subordinates, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community.
Ability to quickly develop strong internal working relationships.
Skilled in the use of the internet, spreadsheets, and word processing software.
Ability to process computer data and to format and generate reports in Yardi.


Skills, Experience, And Education

Must have a minimum 6 years of experience as a Service Manager in multi family maintenance
EPA, HVAC, CPO and MPO certifications
CAMT certified
Must have knowledge of OSHA safety rules and regulations.
Must have management skills.
Excellent customer service skills.
Must be able to work a flex schedule and be on-call for emergencies on weekends, evenings and holidays.
Valid Driver's License with no major violations within the past 12 months is required.

It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field
Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:
100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents
A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees)
Family Support programs including 8 weeks Paid Primary Caregiver leave, adoption assistance and back-up child care
Opportunity to participate in our hybrid work from home test. This program is a pilot test and subject to change. Based on tenure and performance eligibility, you will have the opportunity to work from home up to 100 days per year

The Sr. HRIS Configuration Analyst will be responsible for Workday HCM configurations, upgrades, security, and support. Consults with stakeholders to understand the structure, policies, and operations of the organization and recommends Workday solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. Ensures alignment and awareness of future Workday functionality releases and ensures successful implementation. Executes mass changes such as re-organizations, acquisitions, divestitures. Be a mentor to provide guidance and timely feedback for other analysts. Work individually or within project teams and participate in all phases of the development life cycle, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, transition, and support; set expectations and determine the timing of availability and delivery of projects.

Key Responsibilities:


Recommends process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions, and policy changes. Utilizes technology as a lever to facilitate business process improvements for end users. Serves as liaison with third parties and other stakeholders, such as payroll, benefits, and compensation. Manages projects and annual process cycles and help design solutions.


Serves as technical configuration contact for assigned applications and functional areas, ensures data integrity, conducts testing of system changes, performs report writing, and analyzes data flows for data integrity and process improvement opportunities.


Leads new implementation projects and recurring human resources processes.


Manages and maintains configuration of the core Workday system including organizations and security and business processes relating to all HR modules across Workday.


Provides production support, including researching and resolving Workday problems, unexpected results, or process flaws; performs scheduled activities; recommends solutions or alternate methods to meet requirements. Communicates to internal customers regarding Workday features and functionality.


Ensures internal customer support issues and requests are addressed within defined SLA's. Monitors case management system and acts as a resource for colleagues to ensure all cases are completed in a timely manner.


Support HR Shared Service and IT technical teams to research and create data integrations with external systems, including applicant tracking, background checks, benefits administration, and other external vendors. Will also troubleshoot and correct issues with existing integrations as required.


Continually researches, tests and stays up to date on all Workday updates and fixes, including performing system testing for Workday delivered twice a year release.


Maintains up to date documentation on all system configurations and end user job aids.


Executes mass data changes, ensuring highest level of data integrity and customer service orientation.


Supports acquisition and divestiture activities in managing worker data records, organizations, security, and related business processes.


Works under consultative direction toward predetermined long-range targets. Determines and pursues courses of action essential in obtaining desired outcomes.

Minimum Requirements:


7+ years of progressive HRIS or related experience, preferably in a large corporation within a matrixed environment


Extensive experience with Workday HCM configurations, upgrades, security, and support required (multiple modules)


Advanced Microsoft Excel expertise and spreadsheet data management

Critical Skills:


Deep understanding of Workday data and structure, business processes, reporting and security and authentication capabilities.


Requires knowledge and experience in own discipline to manage high volume workload and respond to customer requests.


Proven track record of applying proper judgment and discretion.


Skilled in handling complex problems and providing solutions that are highly creative. Uses independent judgement to accomplish objectives.


Advanced analytical/problem solving skills to handle complex customer requests using systems and company knowledge.


Detail oriented, with excellent follow-through and capability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Systems thinking orientation, with proven track record of identifying and addressing root causes.


Skilled in managing multiple, high priority tasks and adjusting to shifting priorities, while meeting deadlines.


Exceptional oral and written communication skills.


Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.


Strong knowledge of software development, testing, maintenance, and support.


Proficiency with productivity software like Microsoft Office and Google Apps (Docs, Sheets, etc.).

Additional Skills & Knowledge:


Workday certification preferred

Education:


Bachelor's degree required with experience in human resources, business analysis, information systems or a related field required.

Job Overview

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Trading Partner Analyst with a minimum of 3 years of proven expertise in partner operations and business analysis. This role will be pivotal in optimizing our partner relationships, ensuring compliance, and enhancing operational efficiency. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, familiarity with reporting tools and project management, and an understanding of the Healthcare insurance industry.

Responsibilities:
Partner Operations 60%
Cultivate and nurture strong relationships with our valued partners. You will be the primary point of contact for inquiries, concerns, and feedback, playing a pivotal role in enhancing partner implementation and satisfaction.
Collaborate with Business Operations to evaluate partner capabilities, alignment with business goals, and contractual obligations.
Work closely with business units to gather specific requirements and expectations for new partners.
Evaluate technical feasibility and ensure seamless integration of partner systems with existing IT infrastructure.
Develop detailed onboarding and integration plans, timelines, and milestones for new partners.
Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and service level agreements (SLAs) for partner performance measurement.
Assist in the partner selection process by providing data-driven recommendations based on business needs and assessments.
Regularly review partner performance, assess costs and benefits, and identify opportunities for improvement or consolidation.
Maintain open communication channels with partners, create improvement plans when necessary, and collaborate to monitor progress.
Business Analysis 40%
Collect customer requirements and technical issues, and design data analysis processes to meet business needs.
Analyze current business requirements, document processes, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement process changes and improvements.
Provide support to end-users on processes and systems, participating in testing and quality assurance of new systems and processes.
Provide regular updates on project status, risks, and issues to relevant stakeholders.
Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations, including data privacy and security.
Write clear and well-structured business requirements/documents.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices.

Must reside in commutable distance to Dallas, TX; Hybrid option available for preferred candidate.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in business operations, business analysis, and requirements gathering.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience in the Healthcare insurance industry.
Strong working knowledge of relevant Microsoft applications.
Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Familiarity with project management tools and software, such as Jira and Confluence.
Knowledge of healthcare industry standards and regulations, including GDPR and HIPAA.
An ability to collaborate effectively with a diverse, global workforce.

Familiarity with Agile/SAFe and Waterfall methodologies.
Familiarity with X12/EDI Specifications.
Spanish speaking a plus.
